Missouri Scholarships


180Th Anniversary Scholarships
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Cincinnati College of Applied Science. more...

A+ Award
Scholarship for first time freshmen enrolling at William Woods University. Applicants must have graduated from an A+ certified high school and have completed the requirements for the A+ program. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

A+ Leadership Award
Scholarship for Missouri residents who are incoming freshmen accepted to Stephens College. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, minimum ACT score of 21 or SAT score of 15000. Recipients must be residential students. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

A+ Scholarship
Scholarship for Missouri residents that are first-time freshmen students who graduated from an A+ high school in Missouri and are planning to attend Webster University. Award is based on applicants cumulative GPAQ and class rank. Candidate must have a minimum score of 1000 on SAT or 21 on the ACT. Number of awards varies. more...

A-Plus Scholarship
Scholarship for graduating high school seniors planning to attend full-time at Park University. Students must have a minimum 3.25 CGPA or 2800 GED score and a minimum 24 ACT score or 1110 SAT score. Applicants must attend an A+ eligible high school. Award amount is for 50% of tuition. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

A.C. Ingersoll Jr. Memorial Fellowship In Transportation Studies
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients of the fellowship will be currently enrolled Undergraduate or Graduate students at the University of Missouri – St. Louis who are pursing a Certificate in Transportation Studies for the furtherance of studies in marine engineering and transportation. more...

A.C.E. Louise M. Gross Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate seniors attending Southeast Missouri State University, majoring in Education. Applicants must have a minimum 2.4 GPA. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

A.F. Hendricks Physics Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Southeast Missouri State University, majoring in Physics. Applicants must have completed at least 60 credit hours and have a minimum 3.5 GPA. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

A.G. Edwards Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled at Park University majoring in Accounting, Business, Economics or related disciplines. Students must have financial need, academic achievement, and must contribute to the college/university community. Preference given to sons or daughters of A.G. Edwards (AGE) employees. Number of awards may vary. more...

A.R. Herman Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students attending Saint Louis University who are enrolled in the College of Arts and Sciences. Applicants must be an employed Federal work-study program, have financial need and contribute personal funds toward their education. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Contact the College of Arts and Sciences for more information. more...

Aarons Automotive Products-C.R. Wehr, Jr. Scholarship
Annual award for full-time employee or a dependent of a full-time employee of Aarons Automotive Products and is an entering freshman student accepted at Missouri State University. Selection is based on high school performance, college potential as indicated by aptitude tests and leadership qualities. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Abbott And Fenner Annual Scholarship
Abbott & Fenner are committed to continuing their efforts at helping those who have the desire and ambition to succeed. Scholarships are available to all high school juniors and seniors as well as all students currently registered in any accredited post secondary institution. To apply for this scholarship you will need to write a 500- to 1000-word essay on the topic listed on the website.
Please visit Abbott and Fenner’s Scholarship page to learn more about this year’s topic and the application process. more...

Abe & Clara Field Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Stephens College. Selection based on academic achievement, financial need and an interest in public affairs. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. more...

Abraham-Miller Human Resource Management Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University full-time, majoring in Human Resource Management. Applicant must have demonstrated financial need; scholarship; completion of or enrollment in MGT 345; and be an active member of Missouri State Universitys Chapter of Society for Human Resource Management and other professional organizations. more...

Abraham-Miller International Management Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University full-time, majoring in International Management. Applicant must have demonstrated financial need, scholarship, completion of or enrollment in MGT 547, and be an active member of a professional organization. more...

Academic Promise Award
Scholarship for incoming freshmen accepted to Maryville University full-time. Selection criteria based on a minimum ACT score of 24 or SAT score of 1010, and minimum 3.3 GPA. Number of awards may vary. Renewable; maintain 3.2 GPA. more...

Accenture Alumni Scholarship For Outstanding Is Students
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients will be enrolled at UMSL as either a graduate or undergraduate student.
Recipient will be pursuing a Bachelor or Master of Science in Information Systems. Candidates should demonstrate an interest in information systems as a career and show a strong commitment to the profession, in general, and a consulting career within the profession, specifically.
Recipients shall have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher. more...

Access Extra Scholarship
The Access Extra Scholarship is from the Missouri Scholarship & Loan Foundation. This program provides a scholarship for students eligible for the Access Missouri Financial Assistance Program and who have a 28 or higher on the ACT.
Awards will be prioritized by first-come, first-serve basis and awards will be made until the funding is depleted.
Eligibility
ACT
SAT
Award recipients will be notified in mid-July.
Questions? Contact Melissa Findley, Missouri Scholarship & Loan Foundation, at INFO@MOSLF.org
The Missouri Scholarship & Loan Foundation does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, creed, national origin, gender, age, color, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability.
Please click the VISIT button at the bottom of the page to be taken to the St. Louis Graduates Scholarship Central application to apply. more...

Accounting & Finance Club Scholarship

Accounting Alumni Scholarship
This scholarship will be awarded to an accounting major, based on academic achievement. more...

Accounting Club Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University full-time, majoring in Accounting. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Achievement Award - Cottey College
The Achievement Award is available to entering freshmen at Cottey College. Selection is based on ACT/SAT scores and GPA. more...

Achievement Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time freshmen enrolling at Rockhurst University. Students must have a minimum 3.4 GPA or rank in the top 35% of the class and have a minimum 22 ACT or 1020 SAT. Selection is based on academic credentials. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Ada Endowment And Assistance Fund, Inc. Dental Student Scholarship
The ADA Endowment and Assistance Fund, Inc. Dental Student Scholarship is open to second-year dental students at the University of Missouri-Kansas City. To be considered for this award, you must demonstrate financial need and academic achievement. The School of Dentistry nominates up to two candidates to the ADA for selection. more...

Ada Endowment And Assistance Fund, Inc. Minority Scholarship
The ADA Endowment and Assistance Fund, Inc. Minority Scholarship is open to DDS students in their first, second or third year at the University of Missouri-Kansas City. To be considered for this award, you must be a minority and demonstrate financial need and academic achievement. more...

Adam Aronson Annual Scholarship
This scholarship was established in honor of Adam Aronson, who was the founder and Chairman of Mark Twain Bancshares, which is now part of US Bank. He was one of the most innovative bankers of his time, utilizing his marketing skills from two previous business careers, and he was among the first bankers in the country to hire MBAs. He was also a major supporter of the arts in St. Louis. This scholarship is to provide funds for a bright hardworking student who demonstrates financial need.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipient must be an incoming freshman enrolled in the College of Arts & Sciences.
Recipient must be an undergraduate student enrolled in a minimum of 12 credit hours each semester at UMSL (full-time enrollment).
Candidates must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Scholarship can be renewed, provided recipient maintains a cumulative GPA of 2.75 and continues to demonstrate financial need. more...

Adelaide G. Heverly Weige Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students attending Saint Louis University who are majoring in Education. Applicants must have financial need and contribute personal funds toward their education. Preference given to residents from south St. Louis who are parishioners of the Immaculate Heart of Mary Catholic Church. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Contact the College of Arts and Sciences for more information. more...

Adele Dunne Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time, female, undergraduate students attending Saint Louis University who are enrolled in the Parks College of Engineering, Aviation and Technology. Applicants must have financial need and contribute personal funds toward their education. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Contact the Parks College of Engineering, Aviation and Technology for more information. more...

Aden-Gundaker Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time, female undergraduate students attending Saint Louis University who are enrolled in the John Cook School of Business and Administration. Applicants must complete 20 hours of community service per semester, have financial need and contribute personal funds toward their education. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Contact the School of Business and Administration for more information. more...

Adene C. Keller Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate or graduate student attending Southeast Missouri State University, majoring in Voice Training. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Adler-Rosecan Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students attending Saint Louis University. Applicants must have financial need and contribute personal funds toward their education. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Contact the Office of Financial Aid for more information. more...

Adult Learner Return To Learn Scholarship
Annual award for non-traditional, undergraduate student attending Missouri State University. Student must be at least 25 years old and in the first or second semester of their initial college experience or be returning to college after an absence of at least three years. Applicant must possess a high school diploma or GED. Student must submit a recommendation from someone unrelated to the student. Candidate must exhibit excellent prospect of success in a university program. Both degree and non-degree students will be considered for awards. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Adult Re-Entry Scholarship - Jefferson College
The Adult Re-Entry Scholarship is available to entering students at Jefferson College. You must be returning to school after a period of time and reside in Jefferson County. Preference is given to mature individuals who are single parents or who have chosen to pursue a non-traditional career path. more...

Advisors Scholarship-Springfield Life Underwriters
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University, majoring in Insurance and Risk Management. Award amount varies. more...

Aes Engineering Solutions
Scholarship Criteria
Our belief is that achieving a high grade point average should not be the only criteria for determining who deserves to be helped. For that reason we are offering a scholarship that will be awarded on the basis of character, as determined by evaluated the essays that are submitted.
Scholarships are intended for our future leaders across a wide spectrum of fields of study. This award is available to high school seniors and all students attending a post secondary educational facility.
You are not required to be taking Engineering courses to be eligible.
How to Apply
Students must submit an essay of between 500 and 1000 words in answer to the following question:
When you look back on your life in 30 years, what would it take for you to consider your life successful? What people, things and accomplishments do you need?
Submit essay to: scholarships@aesengineers.com
There is no application packet for this award. Please do not include your resume at this time.
Be sure to include your full name as well as the name of the school you are attending this year and your plans for next year. more...

Afton High School Scholarship
Annual award for St. Louis, MO resident that is a graduating high school senior from Affton High School who plans to attend Webster University. Applicant must have a minimum 3.4 GPA, rank in the top 20% of their class and have an ACT score of 24 or above or an SAT score of 1100 or above. Submit a recommendation from candidates high school principal and/or guidance counselor with application packet. more...

Agriculture Alumni Scholarship
Annual award for incoming freshman attending Missouri State University, majoring in Agriculture. Selection is based on high school performance, college potential and leadership abilities. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Agriculture Club Scholarship
Scholarship for one freshman and one upperclassman attending Southeast Missouri State University, majoring or minoring in Agriculture. Applicants must have financial need and have a minimum 2.0 GPA. Award amount varies. more...

Students must have financial need and commit to work in New Jersey after graduation. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Aia Ohio Foundation Scholarship
Scholarship for college seniors or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Cincinnati College of Design, Architecture, Art and Planning School of Architecture and Interior Design majoring in Architecture. Number of awards may vary. more...

Students must demonstrate academic achievement and financial need. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Applicants must be Pi Kappa Delta members and be involved in intercollegiate speech or debate. Selection based on academic achievement and potential. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Akerson Nursing Scholarship
The donors are establishing this scholarship for several reasons:
First, nursing is rightly viewed as nothing less than society’s respected profession. But it must be able to draw the best, brightest, most caring, most dedicated people to its ranks. Those people often do not have the financial wherewithal to fund their educations. The rest of us have an obligation to do what we can to make sure that financial issues are not the reason an otherwise smart, dedicated person was unable to become a nurse.
Second, the donors believe the University of Missouri-St. Louis College of Nursing is unique among nursing schools in that it regularly produces the highest quality graduate nurses and does it as cost-effectively and affordably as possible. They see the school as being an excellent steward of these funds.
Third, they know of the deep commitment the faculty has to the success of their nursing students, and to the quality of care those students will provide to the rest of us in the future.
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be undergraduate students at UMSL in the College of Nursing.
Candidates must be Missouri residents.
Applicants will demonstrate high financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Recipients must enroll full-time at UMSL (12 credit hours) each semester. more...

Al & Margaret Hemphill Scholarship
Annual award for incoming freshman accepted at Missouri State University. First preference given to student who has graduated from a high school in Iowa. If no student meets this criteria, the award may be given to a student in a state that borders Iowa. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. Selection also based on high school performance, college potential, leadership qualities and financial need. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Candidates will have earned a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Preference will be given to students who have contributed to campus life, community work, and/or women’s and gender issues. more...

Albert H. & Dorothy E. Macke Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Southeast Missouri State University, majoring in Education. Preference given to descendants of Albert and Dorothy Macke. If related, applicant must state relationship on the application. If no descendant applies, award is available to other undergraduate Education majors, typically in senior year. Award is for one semester only. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Albert J. Weis Memorial Science Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Southeast Missouri State University full-time, majoring in any one of the disciplines within the College of Science and Mathematics. Applicants must have earned 42 hours of college credit, have a minimum 2.0 GPA or above, and have financial need. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable; must reapply. more...

Albertson & Davidson, Llp College Scholarship
At the law firm of Albertson & Davidson, LLP we understand that obtaining an education is the pathway to success for many young Americans. As attorneys, we all have earned both undergraduate degrees as well as successfully completed a rigorous three-year Juris Doctorate before being even eligible to sit for the California Bar Exam. Through these experiences, we have come to understand the often significant financial burdens associated with obtaining an education beyond high school, which is why we are pleased to announce that we will be awarding $2,500 college scholarship to the winner of our newly created essay contest. By creating this award, we hope to help the next generation of students realize their educational and professional goals.
To apply, please click the VISIT button at the bottom of the page. more...

Alpha Delta Kappa-Alpha Tau Chapter Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduates freshmen or sophomores attending Southeast Missouri State University, majoring in Education. Freshmen must rank in the upper one-third of their class and score in the top one-third on standardized tests. Sophomores must have at least 30 credit hours with a 2.5 GPA. Submit a list of three persons (i.e. principal, teacher, pastor, etc.) who may be contacted as a reference. Requires separate application. Number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable; maintain 2.5 GPA. more...

Amanda Cates Memorial Scholarship
Amanda Cates was a dedicated, four year veteran of the Normandy Police Department and worked as a school resource officer for Normandy Middle School. Her enthusiasm and love for the children that she went to work to protect made her a beloved mentor and role model; she always took the opportunity to let students know how important it was to stay in school and get a good education. Amanda’s life was tragically cut short on August 29, 2006.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients will be undergraduate students.
Recipients must be enrolled full-time at UMSL (12 credit hours each semester).
Recipients must be majoring in one of the social science disciplines or in the School of Social Work.
Recipients must have earned a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Preference will be given to students who are graduates of the Normandy School District. more...

Ambassador Scholarship - Ozark Christian College
The Ambassador Scholarship is available to students at Ozark Christian College who have placed in the top three positions in any major preaching/ public speaking contest at any state teen convention or the North American Christian Convention. more...

Students must be in the top 150 in the American Mathematics Contest. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

American Family Insurance Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate junior or senior student attending Missouri State University full-time, majoring in Insurance and Risk Management or Insurance minor. Preference given to student with financial need. Applicant must have completed one insurance and risk management course with continued enrollment in advanced courses. Student must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, demonstrate leadership through campus, community or other civic activities and work experience, with preference for active member of Gamma lota Sigma or other recognized insurance industry organization. Renewable; must reapply. more...

Preference given to student who is currently enrolled in or has completed mathematics courses in actuarial science and one course in insurance & risk management. Preference also given to student majoring in actuarial science. Applicant must have a minimum 2.75 GPA with leadership, character and financial need. Renewable; must reapply. more...

Annual Cgtrader Scholarship 2017
CGTrader is the largest 3D model marketplace backed by the strong designer community of more than 500k members. CGTrader was founded with the goal to ensure fair marketplace conditions for 3D designers.
Each semester CGTrader challenges students to dig into the field of technology writing an essay on how innovative technologies are transforming our lives.
Enter the CGTrader Scholarship 2017 challenge to win $3,000 for your education bills. The best submission will be awarded $2,000 while the two runners-up will receive $500 each.
For more information and to apply for this scholarship, please click the VISIT button at the bottom of the page. more...

At&T Foundation Endowed Scholarship For Math, Engineering, Technology And Science
Scholarship Criteria
Awards from this scholarship will be made to first-time freshmen students, with preference given to students who have participated in the Bridge Program or any successor program to enhance math, engineering, technology, or science education.
Recipients must enroll full time at UMSL (a minimum of 12 credit hours each semester).
Recipients must have earned a 3.0 cumulative high school GPA.
Recipients must be seeking an undergraduate degree in a STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics) discipline.
Scholarship is renewable, provided student maintains a 3.2 cumulative UMSL GPA and continues to pursue his/her first undergraduate degree in a STEM discipline. more...

Ava’s Grace Scholarship Foundation
Ava’s Grace Scholarship Foundation benefits students who have or have had an incarcerated parent or primary caregiver. Ava’s Grace’s mission is to break the cycle of incarceration through the gift of education, specifically through awarding 4-year scholarships for higher education purposes. The work of Ava’s Grace Scholarship Foundation provides hope to young men & women who have dreams of higher education and a different life. Through our parent organization, Connections to Success, Ava’s Grace scholars receive personal and professional development training and ongoing mentorships while pursuing their unique educational and career goals.
Criteria
Applicant must have a parent who is or has been incarcerated in a U.S. penitentiary (state or federal).
Applicant must be a permanent resident of Missouri, Kansas or Illinois for at least two years prior to the date of the application.
Must demonstrate financial need.
Must have achieved a minimum cumulative 2.5 grade point average on a 4.0 scale.
Must plan to enroll in or be currently enrolled in a degree program at a nonprofit higher education institution accredited by a regional accrediting body (North Central or its equivalent in the region).
Must be seeking a first Technical, first Associate or first Bachelor’s degree. more...

Belvia I. Smith And David W. Smith Memorial Business School Scholarship
Belvia Irene Scott (February 27, 1913 – March 4, 1998) was born in Nixon, Tennessee and David Wilson Smith (December 9, 1908 – February 11, 1968) was born in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. Neither went past the 4th grade. Belvia’s parents were both deceased by the time she was 14. Belvia and David each moved to St. Louis where they dated and married. David worked 30 years on the production line for Fisher Body, a division of General Motors. Belvia held jobs outside of the home but eventually became a full-time homemaker for her family. With rural, humble beginnings and little education, Belvia and David raised three sons and a daughter, instilling in them virtues such as honesty, appreciation, hard work, generosity, and compassion. This scholarship is established to honor Belvia and David Smith for all they did for their children, grandchildren, great-grandchildren, and other family and friends.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients must be Missouri residents.
Recipients will demonstrate high financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Preference will be given to students enrolled in the College of Business Administration.
Incoming freshmen will be considered for this scholarship. more...

Selection based on academic ability, character and financial need. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Recipient may receive the award for one additional semester. No student may receive the award for more than two successive terms. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Cgtrader Scholarship
Enter the CGTrader Scholarship 2016 challenge to win $1,000 for your education bills. All you have to do is write and submit an original essay on the topic “The future of virtual reality: on the footsteps of changing the world or on the brink of failure?”
Yes, this is a very broad topic, but that is how VR is – the potential is great yet uncertain; there are a lot of potential applications, but there’s also a lot of over-excitement, too. You can narrow down the topic to whatever your vision or interest with VR is – whether you are thinking about the conceptual pros and cons of the medium, writing about specific applications that excite you, reviewing technological advancements, or doing some critical business thinking regarding this new medium, you are doing the right thing. Please click the VISIT button at the bottom of the page to apply. more...

Charles Studyvin Scholar/Leader Award

Charles W. Armbruster Undergraduate Chemistry Scholarship
Charles Armbruster began teaching at UM-St. Louis in 1962 as a chemistry instructor and in 1964 was appointed Chair of the Division of Science. He held that position until 1968 when he became Chair of the Department of Chemistry. He was responsible for hiring chemists, physicists, and biologists until individual departments took over that role. In addition, he was mainly responsible for the technical aspects of designing both Benton and Stadler Halls. As Chair of the Division of Science and the Department of Chemistry from 1964 to 1975, Armbruster was one of the most influential figures on campus. As indicated by former Chancellor Blanche M. Touhill in her book, “The Emerging University,” during the 1963-64 academic year Armbruster was the major influence on then-Chancellor James Bugg in the effort to urge him to change his goal of establishing a large four-year institution into one that would offer graduate education through the doctoral level. Armbruster’s efforts led to the establishment of Ph.D. programs in chemistry and psychology in 1971. Charlie was best known as the favorite teacher of thousands of science students whom he taught introductory or organic chemistry. In 1992 he took an early retirement but continued to teach a full load in the department, both during the academic year and the summers, and served as the premedical school adviser until he left the St. Louis area in 1998 to settle in Florida.
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be undergraduate students at UMSL who are majoring in Chemistry or Biochemistry.
Preference will be given to incoming students who transfer from other universities or community colleges.
Applicants must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Recipients must enroll in a minimum of 9 credit hours at UMSL each semester. more...

Charleston, Missouri Education Fund Scholarship
Scholarship for Charleston, Missouri high school graduates who are undergraduate students attending Southeast Missouri State University, majoring in Education. Financial need is a determining factor. Award amount varies. Renewable; maintain 2.25 GPA. more...

Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students attending Saint Louis University who are enrolled in the Parks College of Engineering, Aviation and Technology pursuing an A&P; Certificate. Applicants must have financial need and contribute personal funds toward their education. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Contact the Parks College of Engineering, Aviation and Technology for more information. more...

Charlotte A. And John E. Martin Endowed Scholarship
A graduate of the University of Missouri-St. Louis with a M.S. in Biology, Charlotte is grateful for the opportunity and the education she received. Charlotte and her husband John wish to create a scholarship fund to benefit those students in need of financial assistance that have particularly challenging obstacles in their personal lives that can detract from their objective of completing their degree. The Charlotte A. and John E. Martin Endowed Scholarship is created to serve those students needing extra support.
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be incoming freshman at UMSL in the College of Arts and Sciences.
Candidates will have earned a cumulative high school GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Applicants must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Recipients must enroll full-time at UMSL (12 credit hours) each semester. more...

Charlotte A. And John E. Martin Endowed Scholarship Ii In Arts And Sciences
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be incoming freshman at UMSL in the College of Arts and Sciences.
Candidates will have earned a cumulative high school GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Applicants must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Recipients must enroll full-time at UMSL (12 credit hours) each semester.
Applicants must complete an essay describing how you faced a challenge; for example, being a single parent or family caregiver, losing someone close to you, change in family or employment circumstances, or similar.
Students wishing to apply for this scholarship must apply to the Charlotte A and John E Martin Endowed Scholarship. more...

Cheap Car Insurance Commercial Video Scholarship
Cheap Car Insurance will award at least one winner a year a $5,000 scholarship for their best rendition of a commercial promoting auto insurance and its value to high school and college students.
To apply for this opportunity, please visit www.cheapcarinsuranceco.com/commercial-video-scholarship-win-to-help-pay-for-college.html more...

Csi Leasing, Inc., Opportunity Scholarship
Scholarship Criteria
Candidate(s) will be graduates from high schools in the following Missouri counties: Franklin, Jefferson, Lincoln, St. Charles, St. Francois, St. Louis, St. Louis City, Warren, and Washington.
Preference will be given to students from the Ferguson-Florissant School District.
Preference will be given to first-generation college students.
Recipients will have a cumulative GPA of 3.2 or higher.
Incoming freshman candidates must be in the top 10 percent of their graduating high school class.
Candidates will be pursuing a bachelor’s degree through the College of Business Administration.
Recipients must enroll in a minimum of 12 credit hours at UMSL each semester (full-time enrollment).
Recipient(s) must demonstrate potential for leadership through involvement in extracurricular activities or community service while at UMSL. more...

Annual award for undergraduate or graduate student attending Southeast Missouri State University, majoring in Biology. First preference given to a biology graduate student attending a marine biological station; followed by a biology graduate student attending a field station; with third preference being a biology undergraduate attending a marine biological station. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Award will cover tuition and other expenses incurred by student while attending classes or conducting research. more...

Scholarship for minority Ohio residents who are graduating high school seniors planning to attend full-time at the University of Cincinnati. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and a minimum 24 ACT score or a minimum 1090 SAT score. Award amount is for up to full tuition and books. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Dean Rickey George Memorial Scholarship
The family and friends of Dean Rickey George established a memorial scholarship following his untimely death in 1995. Dr. Rickey George was a professor of counseling, author of numerous journal articles and books, and noted scholar who had a lasting impact on the counseling department in the College of Education at the University of Missouri – St. Louis. A well respected, hard working and congenial colleague, Dean George assisted fellow faculty members in their research efforts, which often led to promotion and tenure. Before being appointed to the position of Interim Dean and then Dean of the College of Education, Dr. George was active in various campus committees and the faculty senate.
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be enrolled in UMSL’s College of Education.
Preference will be given to masters or doctoral students in the Division of Counseling and Family Therapy.
Recipients will have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.5 and have completed at least 18 graduate hours in counseling. more...

Dean's Fellowship - Washington University
The Dean's Fellowship is open to undergraduate and graduate students at Washington University who are enrolled in University College. You must have achieved a minimum GPA of 3.7 to qualify for this award. more...

Applicant must be a U.S. citizen. Selection based on academic performance and financial need. Award amount and number of awards may vary. Renewable. Dennis Bohnenkamp Award
This award honors the dedication of Associate Dean Dennis Bohnenkamp to the students of the Pierre Laclede Honors College and also will recognize the achievement and commitment to the humanities by a promising Honors College student. The Bohnenkamp fund was established by the Pierre Laclede Honors College alumni chapter at the time of Associate Dean Dennis Bohnenkamp’s retirement and donations have come from former students and UMSL faculty and staff. Further donations came as memorials after Dennis’s death in 2006. At his wish, the scholarship is intended to support the study of the humanities—especially the study of the humanities by those in other majors.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipient must be a full-time student (12 hours at UMSL each semester) who is in good standing in the Pierre Laclede Honors College at UMSL.
Preference will be given to seniors. more...

Earl C. And Frances E. Aubuchon Memorial Scholarship
Earl AuBuchon and Frances (Taylor) AuBuchon were raised in St. Francois County, in the Lead Belt region of southeastern Missouri. Earl met Frances, a friend of his sister, prior to World War II. They were married at the end of the war when Earl returned from serving overseas in the Army Air Corps. Shortly thereafter they moved to South St. Louis City where they raised 6 children. Earl worked at the same factory job for 41 years while Frances stayed at home with their children.
Although Earl left high school prior to graduation to help support his family financially and Frances received no further education after high school, they placed a great emphasis on the importance of their children doing well in school. They sent their children to Catholic grade and high schools as long as they were able to do so and expected good grades from each of them. Although they could not afford to pay for their children to attend college, they supported their efforts in other ways. Both were avid readers, Earl of the newspaper all his life and in later years of western novels. Fances collected carefully selected books on everything from sewing, etiquette, and other homemaking skills to world history, art, and poetry. Of their 6 children, one attended community college, graduating from its nursing school; one attended the University of Missouri — St. Louis for a year; two graduated from UMSL with degrees in Business Administration and Chemistry; and one went on to complete an MBA at Washington University.
After 36 years of marriage, Frances passed away in 1982. Earl died in 2004 at the age of 86. They would have been proud that many of their grandchildren thus far have been able to attend college. This scholarship is meant to honor the sacrifices they made for their children and the value they placed on education. Its purpose is to encourage first generation college attendance for other families.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients must be Missouri residents living in St. Louis City or County.
Recipients must enroll full-time at UMSL and the Pierre Laclede Honors College.
Students must remain in good academic standing, as required by the Honors College, including GPA and program progression.
The award will be made to students where neither parent graduated from a four-year college or university.
Recipients may be new students transferring to UMSL.
Recipients must remain in good standing with the Pierre Laclede Honors College to be considered for renewal. more...

Earl Moulder Hotel Administration Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate junior attending Missouri State University, majoring in Hospital and Restaurant Administration. Applicant must have an overall GPA of at least 3.0. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Economics Alumni Scholarship
In November 2010, the University of Missouri-St. Louis Department of Economics was very fortunate to be able to establish an Economics Alumni Scholarship award with an initial gift from David and Leslie Banks. Thanks to their generosity and that of additional alumni during subsequent years, in 2013 we were able to begin awarding scholarships from this fund to students who have displayed academic merit and strength in the Economics program.
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be undergraduate students at UMSL who are pursuing a degree in Economics.
Candidates will have earned a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Candidates will have completed at least 12 credit hours in Economics and have earned a 3.2 GPA in the major.
Recipients must enroll full-time at UMSL (12 credit hours) each semester. more...

Elizabeth M. Clayton Memorial Scholarship
Elizabeth M. Clayton joined the Department of Economics in 1968 after receiving her Ph.D. from the University of Washington (Seattle). She was professor of economics from 1968 until she retired in 1992. She also served as Associate Vice Chancellor for Research at UMSL.
Elizabeth Clayton won the “triple crown” in economics as the first female professor hired, first female promoted and granted tenure, and first female to serve as department chair. She inspired many students and was a valued colleague in the department. In 1997, she received the University’s Women Trailblazers Award. She was a specialist in Soviet economics, especially of the agricultural sector. During her career, she was a fellow at Harvard University Law School, the Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars, and Moscow State University. She passed away in June 1999 after a battle with cancer.
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be students enrolled at UMSL who are pursuing a degree in Economics.

Undergraduate candidates will have completed at least 75 credit hours towards their degree and at least 18 credit hours of coursework in Economics. Recipients will have earned a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher overall and a 3.2 or higher in Economics. Recipients must enroll in a minimum of 12 credit hours at UMSL each semester (full-time).

Graduate candidates will have completed at least 9 credit hours towards the MA in Economics and will have earned a cumulative graduate GPA of 3.25 or higher. Recipients must enroll in a minimum of 6 credit hours at UMSL each semester. more...

Emma Schlemper Scholarship In Teacher Education
This scholarship was established in honor of the donor’s mother, Emma Emilie Halbach Schlemper. Emma Schlemper was born July 6, 1891 in west St. Louis County in the little community of farmers called Hollow. After finishing the 8th grade, she moved to Gray Summit and worked in the home of a Mr. Borberg, the Superintendent of Schools. While there she prepared for the two-day school teacher certification tests. She traveled to Union, Missouri to take the test and completed it in one day. She taught for three years at Port Royal and at the Tavern Creek School near St. Albans. While teaching at Port Royal she earned $35.00 per month. While teaching at St. Albans she earned $45.00 per month and was charged $10.00 per month for room and board. She taught grades one through eight and had to clean both schools as well. She and her husband, Charlie Schlemper, were married in 1912. They raised their family and farmed 80 acres in St. Louis County. Emma died on February 18, 2001 at the age of 109 years, seven months, and twelve days.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients will be incoming freshmen in an undergraduate teacher education program.
Candidates must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need. more...

Evoke Scholars Program

Scholarship Criteria
Candidates for this scholarship must be Missouri residents.

Candidates must be undergraduate students who are enrolled full-time at UMSL (12 credit hours each semester).
Candidates must be pursing a degree in the College of Business Administration or in Economics. Preference will be given to students who double major in these disciplines, or to students who major in one and minor in the other.

Applicant must plan to take a Field Geography course (GRY470) during the summer semester or a declared Geology or Earth Science Education major enrolled to take a field geology course (GLG412 or 413 or equivalent). Gast Scholarship In Music
Preference will be given to:
a. a full time incoming freshman student (12 hour minimum) with an interest in pursuing a degree in Music at UMSL and either a minimum ACT score of 24 or a high school GPA of 2.8; OR
a full time undergraduate student (12 hour minimum) with a declared major in Music at UMSL and overall GPA of 2.8 or better and a Music GPA of 2.8 or better.
In the event that no student qualifies according to 2.a. or 2.b., then a student in the College of Arts and Sciences may qualify for the award and must be either
a. a full time incoming freshman student (12 hour minimum) with either a minimum ACT score of 24 or a high school GPA of 2.8, OR
a full time undergraduate student (12 hour minimum) with an overall GPA of 2.8 or better.
Scholarship is renewable if the student maintains a GPA of 2.8.
Preference will be given to students who demonstrate financial need as determined by the Office of Student Financial Aid. more...

Gateway To Cybercity Annual Scholarship
The Gateway to CyberCity Scholarship is established to encourage and inspire deserving students regardless of race, creed, gender , orientation or national origin, to pursue academic studies at the University of Missouri-St. Louis in the field of Cyber Security.
The Society of Information Management (SIM) is a national professional network that connects senior-level IT leaders with peers in their communities. The Security Advisory Alliance is a network of CISOs and Senior Leaders at the most influential companies in the world, with over 400 members on three continents. The St. Louis Regional Chamber traces its roots to 1836 as one of the oldest Chambers of Commerce in the U.S., and is driven by one overriding purpose-to inspire a greater St. Louis.
In 2016, the St. Louis Chapter of SIM, the Security Advisor Alliance, and the St. Louis Regional Chamber founded the Gateway to Cyber City Conference to foster growth in the IT Cyber Security industry in the St. Louis region.
Scholarship Criteria
#Candidate will be enrolled at the University of Missouri-ST. Louis in the Cojllege of Business Administration pursuing academic studies in Cyber Security.
#Candidate will have a minimum Cumulative GPA of 2.8.
Applicants will demonstrate financial need as determined by the Financial Aid Office and completed reporting as required on the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
#Applicant(S) who receive this award will be enrolled as members of the Society of Information Management (SIM)
#This scholarship may have mentoring opportunities attached to it.
#This scholarship may be renewable if recipent maintains a GPA of 2.8 and remains in good standing in the College of Business Administration. more...

Gateway To Innovation Scholarship
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be undergraduate students majoring in the College of Business Information Systems Program
Candidates must a have minimum 2.8 cumulative GPA

Applicants must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Candidates will be enrolled as members of the Society of Information Management (SIM) more...

General John J. Pershing Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen admitted to Truman State University. Students must display preeminet academic ability and have an excellent record of participation and leadership in high school/community activities. Selection based on minimum ACT score of 28, 3.8 GPA, and class rank (top 5%). Finalists must attend a personal interview. Award amounts include full tuition, residence hall room and board, study abroad for a semester/summer and membership in the Pershing Society. There is no separate scholarship application; the Undergraduate Application for Admission serves as the scholarship application. Renewable. more...

George Roulhac Pre-Med Scholarship
Dr. George Erwin Roulhac, Jr., a retired neurosurgeon, died on June 24, 1994 at the age of 78.
Dr. Roulhac practiced medicine in St. Louis for 40 years as a partner in Neurosurgical Associates. He was a former staff member at Barnes Hospital and was on the faculty at Washington University and the University of Missouri medical schools.
He was a native of Florence, Georgia. After graduating from Vanderbilt University Medical School, he came to St. Louis in 1941 as an assistant resident in surgery at Barnes Hospital. Shortly after, he was appointed to the staff at the Washington University School of Medicine.
Later, as a clinical associate professor at the University of Missouri, he helped set up a CAT-scan machine at St. Luke’s Hospital, the first at a private hospital in St. Louis.
Dr. Roulhac was a founding member and past president of the Neurological Society of America and the Southern Neurosurgical Society. He was a fellow in the American College of Surgeons, a member of the Cushing Society and the American Association of Neurological Surgeons.
He served in World War II in the 101st General Hospital Unit in France, North Africa and Italy. He twice volunteered for duty on the S.S. Hope, a floating medical center that provided care and training in Nicaragua and Tunisia during his tours.
An avid sportsman and golfer, he was a member of the St. Louis Country Club. Dudley R. Grove, an avid supporter of UMSL, is the daughter of George Roulhac.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients must be undergraduate students who enroll full-time at UMSL (12 hours per semester).
Recipients must be pursuing a pre-med course of study.
Recipients will have earned a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better. more...

Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University, who participates in Handball competitions. Applicant must have a desire to compete in National Collegiate Handball Tournaments. When awarded to a freshman, selection based on high school performance, college potential and leadership. When awarded to a sophomore or higher, applicant must have a minimum 2.0 GPA. Due date and award amount varies. more...

German Scholarship
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be undergraduate students at UMSL who are majoring or minoring in German.
Current UMSL students must hold a GPA of 3.0 in German and a 2.5 overall. In addition, they must have completed four courses in German on the UMSL campus.
Incoming freshmen must have an ACT Composite Score of 23 or better (or the SAT equivalent) and a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher. Preference will be given to students who have completed at least one college-level German course while in high school.
Incoming transfer students must have a transfer GPA of 3.0 or higher and transfer a minimum of 24 credit hours. Preference will be given to students who have completed a minimum of three German courses or the equivalent of German 2101 prior to beginning at UMSL. more...

Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University, majoring in Religious Studies. Applicant must have completed 15 credit hours, including three hours in religious studies, and have a minimum 3.25 GPA. Candidate must have completed either REL 330 (Judaism), REL 340 (Christianity), or REL 350 (Islam), or be taking one of these courses at the time of application. Student must complete 6 hours of religious studies classes during the academic year in which the award is given. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Give Mohr Annual Scholarship
Requirements:
Recipient must be enrolled and pursuing a degree in the College of Business Administration.
Recipient must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Preferences:
In order to achieve the benefits of a diverse student body, preference shall be given to students from underrepresented minority groups.
Renewal:
Scholarship shall be renewed so long as the recipient maintains a minimum 3.0 GPA
Should the University be unable to identify a student who meets all of the criteria stated herein, an award will be made to a student who most closely fits the above criteria. more...

Harriett Woods Leadership Scholarship
This fund was established by a generous gift from the Honorable Harriett Woods, the first woman to be elected Lt. Governor of Missouri. The fund supports female students who demonstrate academic promise and leadership potential. This scholarship lives on to remember Harriet Woods and to remind all of us of her strong commitment to leadership, particularly in the St. Louis community.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients shall be undergraduates who are enrolled full-time at UMSL (12 hours per semester).
Recipients shall be members in good standing with the Pierre Laclede Honors College.
Preference shall be given to female students.
Recipients shall possess and demonstrate leadership ability and shall have evidence of significant contributions to the community. more...

Hilda And Roy Bergmann Scholarship For Art
Scholarship Criteria
#The recipient must be an undergraduate student majoring in Fine Arts with a demonstrated interest in painting, and an appreciation for water color painting of natural subjects.
#The recipient must have a minimum GPA of 2.7 on a four-point scale.
#The recipient may be a sophomore, junior or senior level student.
#The scholarship is non-renewable. more...

Hilda And Roy Bergmann Scholarship For Literature
Roy W. Bergmann was a founding member of the University of Missouri – St. Louis in 1963. Known as the “Committee of 28,” this visionary group saw the grounds of the former Bellerive Country Club as a potential opportunity for an institution of higher learning. A practicing attorney, Roy had an interest in writing. Though never published, his essays and poems are included in the Roy W. Bergmann Papers, 1932-1996. These are archived in the Western Historical Manuscript Collection at the University of Missouri – St. Louis. His late wife, Hilda, had a passion for water color painting, especially for natural subjects.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients must be undergraduate students at UMSL who are majoring in English literature with a demonstrated interest in historical and fictional writing.
Recipients may be sophomore-, junior-, or senior-level students.
Recipients must have a minimum GPA of 2.7 on a four-point scale. more...

This scholarship is awarded to students in the Department of Music. more...

Hispanic Dental Association Foundation Scholarship - Umkc
The Hispanic Dental Association Foundation Scholarship is open to entering dental or dental hygiene students at the University of Missouri-Kansas City who are in their first or third year of dental school or are working toward their B.A. To be considered for this award, you must have Hispanic parentage, a meritorious academic record, community service, leadership and/or extracurricular involvement. more...

Hispanic Scholarship Resources
For the first time in our country’s history, the majority of U.S. high school students headed to college are Hispanic. Latinos now represent about 17 percent of all college students, up from 11 percent in 2006, and according to the Pew Hispanic Center, more females than males are earning degrees.
Some Hispanic students face unique challenges that can put a damper on their plans for post-secondary education. For example, their parents may have inconsistent seasonal work, or lack the documentation needed to help secure a student loan easily. While these issues may seem difficult to overcome, they are not insurmountable. We provide several resources intended to help Hispanic students overcome the higher education costs that often create a roadblock to degree completion . Please click VISIT at the bottom of the page to be taken to the the website and apply. more...

History Bowl Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate junior or senior attending Missouri State University, majoring in History, who is a member of the first or second place team in the annual Missouri State History Bowl competition. Applicant must be nominated by a sponsoring high school teacher. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Howard Yasbin Annual Scholarship In Arts & Sciences
Scholarship Criteria
Applicants must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Candidates must be undergraduate students who enroll full-time in the College of Arts and Sciences at UMSL (12 hours per semester).
Candidates must have a 24 ACT or a 2.5 High School GPA/ OR a 2.5 transfer GPA to be eligible.
Preference will be given to incoming freshmen; however, transfer students may qualify.
Candidate must be one of the following to qualify:
Veteran
Family member of a veteran
A member of UMSL’s ROTC program more...

Scholarship Criteria
Recipients of this scholarship shall be under-represented minority students (African-American, Native American, Hispanic) at UMSL.
Recipients will live in the St. Louis metropolitan area.
Candidates must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Recipients shall have demonstrated some leadership abilities at work or in school activities, clubs, organizations, or the community.
Recipients shall be first-time freshmen who have demonstrated academic promise.
Recipients must enroll full-time at UMSL (12 credit hours) each semester. more...

Applicant must have completed 20 credit hours of the pre-med core including organic chemistry with a 3.5 GPA and be actively involved in a community service or pre-professional organization. Genevieve, Scott, Stoddard, Washington or Wayne. Additionally, you must have a minimum GPA of 2.75. Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University, majoring in Humanities, Public Affairs or Religious Studies. Preference given to a full-time religious studies major or minor. Applicant must have completed 12 hours, including 3 hours of religious studies, with a minimum 3.0 GPA. Candidate must have completed, or be currently enrolled in, REL 131 or REL 332. Recipient must complete 3 hours of religious studies during the academic year. Due date and award amount varies. more...

James T. Broadnax Memorial Scholarship
The donor is using this opportunity to honor her father, an African American man, for his hard work and dedication to his family and community. James T. Broadnax was licensed to teach public school in Choctaw County, Mississippi, but did not meet Missouri certification requirements when he came to St. Louis in 1943. He declined an offer from a family member for the resources to complete his education training as he had the responsibility to provide for his growing family. Despite being unable to continue his career in the teaching profession, his love of education was communicated to his five daughters, three of whom became educators.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients must be Missouri residents.
Recipients will be undergraduate students enrolled full-time at UMSL (12 hours each semester).
Recipients must be pursuing a bachelor’s degree through the College of Education.
Preference will be given to African American students so long as the law allows.
Recipients will demonstrate high financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). more...

Annual award for undergraduate junior or senior attending Missouri State University, majoring in History. Applicant must have a minimum overall GPA of 3.0. Consideration given for financial need. Due date and award amount varies. more...

James Woodward German Scholarship

Jane M. Klausman Women In Business Scholarship
Women make up nearly 50 percent of the global workforce; however, gender equality is not yet a reality in senior management and corporate boardrooms around the world. According to a 2014 Catalyst Census 1, women hold only 4.2 percent of the CEO positions and 19.2 percent of board seats at S&P 500 companies. To encourage more women to pursue education and careers in business, Zonta International established the Jane M. Klausman Women in Business Scholarship. Twelve (12) international scholarships of US$7,000 each and up to 32 district/region scholarships of US$1,000 each are awarded each year.
Women of any age, pursuing an accredited business or business-related program who demonstrate outstanding potential in the field, are eligible and encouraged to apply. For a full list of the eligibility and application requirements, please refer to the application.
Please click the VISIT button at the bottom of the page to be taken to the Zonta International website for more information and to apply. more...

Preference given to Bracken, Campbell, Mason, or Pendleton County, Kentucky residents with financial need. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Recipients shall demonstrate academic achievement as reflected in the recipient’s cumulative grade point average, leadership in ensembles and other Music Department organizations, and by the acceptance of student responsibility and involvement in community activities.
Selection shall be made by the music faculty based on applications submitted by students and must include an essay indicating post-graduate plans and the potential impact of the award on the fulfillment of their plans. more...

John F. Sander Memorial Scholarship
John F. Sander met Susan, his wife of 37 years, while attending undergraduate classes at the University of Missouri – St. Louis. Both majored in political science. John went on to law school and became a practicing attorney, and Susan focused her political science concentration with a secondary education degree. John was a devoted family man and took pride in his wonderful marriage, children, and grandchildren. A surprising and unexpected cancer diagnosis led to his untimely death. His family would like to remember John in his many roles which embodied his Christian values- altar boy, boy scout, former seminarian, husband, father, and grandfather.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients will be undergraduate students enrolled in a minimum of 12 hours at UMSL (full-time) each semester.
Recipients will have a minimum GPA of 2.5.
Recipients will demonstrate an involvement in extracurricular activities, whether on campus or in the community, or carry a heavy work load to defray the costs of tuition.
Preference will be given to applicants who complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need. more...

Applicants must have completed 35 credit hours at Southeast with a 3.0 GPA, and have demonstrated financial need. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Julie And Robin Kerry Memorial Scholarship
In memory of her daughters Robin and Julie Kerry, Ginny Kerry established this scholarship.
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be sophomores in good standing in the Pierre Laclede Honors College.
Students must demonstrate a commitment to their educations and work part-time. more...

Jung-Anderson Scholarship (In The Pierre Laclede Honors College)
The Jung-Anderson Scholarship is a merit award for students whose academic record suggests high potential for graduating from the University of Missouri – St. Louis with distinction through the generosity of Richard K. Jung, Ed.D. (BA English 1971) and his wife Janice Anderson, Ph.D.
Scholarship Criteria
#Recipient must be a full-time student (12 hours at UMSL each semester) who is in good standing in the Pierre Laclede Honors College at UMSL.
#Preference will be given to an incoming freshman, but may be awarded to sophomores and juniors.
#Preference will also be given to student who have demonstrated entrepreneurial spirit.
The recipient will be selected based on academic merit (GPA, class rank, ACT or SAT scores), admission essays, letters of recommendation, and extracurricular activities.
In the event of a tie, the award will be based on financial need. As such, applicants are encouraged to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). more...

Junior Academy Of Science Scholarship
Annual award for incoming freshman student attending Missouri State University, enrolled in the College of Natural and Applied Sciences. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Junior Year Abroad Scholarship
Scholarship for college juniors enrolled full-time at the University of Cincinnati McMicken College of Arts and Sciences Department of German Studies. Students must be pursuing one year of study at the University of Munich. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Scholarship for college seniors enrolled full-time at the University of Cincinnati College of Design, Architecture, Art and Planning School of Architecture and Interior Design. Students must demonstrate academic achievement, devotion to community service, and a sense of loyalty to the university. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Kansas City Hispanic Scholarship & Matching Grant
Scholarship for Hispanic graduate students enrolled at Park University majoring in Management/Business. Students must be U.S. citizens/permanent residents, demonstrate academic achievement, financial need, and participation in community service. An essay must be included with application packet. more...

Kansas City Initiative Scholarship
Scholarship for minority residents of the Kansas City Metropolitan area who are undergraduate students attending a UNCF member college or university or the University of Missouri at Kansas City. Applicants who are entering freshmen must have a minimum 2.5 GPA; upperclassmen must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Students must submit the FAFSA. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Kansas City Life General Agents Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate junior or senior attending Missouri State University full-time, majoring in Insurance and Risk Management or Insurance minor. Preference given to student pursuing career in life and health insurance or employee benefits. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and completion of one insurance and risk management course and continued current enrollment in advanced insurance and risk management courses. more...

Scholarship for graduating high school seniors from the Greater Kansas City area who are enrolled at the University of Missouri in Kansas City. Students must have a minimum 2.0 GPA. Number of awards may vary. more...

Scholarship for incoming freshmen accepted at Southeast Missouri State University, majoring in Art. Applicant must submit 10 photographic slides of his/her artwork for review, along with a self-addressed stamped envelope for return of slides. Kathleen T. Osborn Alumni Scholarship
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients shall be full-time undergraduates or graduate students at UMSL .
Undergraduate students must have a cumulative GPA of 2.5 or higher. Graduate students must have a GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Recipients shall exemplify leadership in campus activities related to the advancement of UMSL students and the University. more...

Kathleen Turner Endowed Performance Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University, majoring in Theatre. Applicant must have completed 75 hours, have a minimum 3.0 GPA, and have a strong commitment to continue to work in the professional world. Candidate must present a 10 minute audition scene of at least two pieces of contrasting nature selected from both the modern and period drama. Student must be involved in the activities of the department. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Kathryn & James Golding Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate junior or senior student attending Missouri State University full-time, majoring in Accounting. Preference given to student who is working at least part-time. Preference also given to a student whose permanent residence is in Barry, Lawrence or Newton counties, but may extend to other Southwest Missouri counties. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and demonstrate consistent and sound work ethic. Award amount varies. more...

Kdm Technology Consulting Scholarship In Computer Science
Scholarship Criteria
Recipient must be an incoming freshman in the College of Arts and Sciences and majoring in Computer Science.
Recipient must enroll in a minimum of 12 credit hours at UMSL each semester (full-time enrollment).
Incoming freshman student must have achieved a minimum score of 28 on the ACT (or SAT equivalent).
Scholarship is renewable if the student maintains a minimum GPA of 3.00 and continues to major in Computer Science in the College of Arts and Sciences. more...

Kenneth C. Thomson Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University, majoring in Geology. Preference given to students with interest in the academic study of caves or karst terrain through successful completion of GLG350 (Speleology) or completion of or concurrent enrollment in a GLG499 project focusing on a cave or karst-related issue. Preference also given to students who have not received other scholarship awards from the GGP department over the same period. Selection based on academic performance in courses required in the geology major, with greater weight given to courses taken during the preceding three semesters. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Kenneth E. & Jane A. Meyer Scholarship
Annual award for resident of Lawrence or Bates County, Missouri who is an undergraduate student attending Missouri State University full-time, majoring in Business Administration. Preference given to student from the city of Mt. Vernon or Butler in that order. For entering freshmen, graduation in the upper quarter of class, college potential and leadership. For other applicants, minimum 2.5 GPA. Candidates must have character, leadership and scholarship. Renewable; must reapply. more...

Genevieve County; 2) Students who reside in any of the Missouri couties in the primary University services region; and 3) students who resided in Missouri outside of the primary University service region. Lawrence Barton Scholarship
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be undergraduate Chemistry majors at UMSL.
Preference will be given to juniors.
Preference will be given to first-generation college students.
Preference will be given to students who demonstrate financial need as determined on theFree Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Recipients will demonstrate academic success through their GPAs, as well as through faculty input and a demonstrated interest in Chemistry.
Recipients must enroll in a minimum of 9 credit hours at UMSL each semester. more...

Lawrence E. & Crystal Pummill Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Missouri State University, majoring in Mathematics. Preference given to those preparing to teach Mathematics. One award given to an entering freshman who received first place in either individual or team competition in Lawrence E. Pummill Math relays. The freshman award is based on high school performance, college potential and leadership qualities. Two awards or more given to sophomore level or above mathematics majors who have maintained an overall GPA of at least 3.0 and a GPA of 3.5 in Mathematics. Consideration given for financial need. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Leaders Of Tomorrow Scholarship
Scholarship Criteria

Candidates will be Missouri residents.

Leadership Activity Award-Freshmen
Scholarship for incoming freshmen accepted to Maryville University full-time. Selection criteria based on 3.0 GPA, ACT score of 21 or SAT score of 880, two letters of recommendation, and demonstrated leadership in at least two high school or community activities. Award amount for commuter students is $1,200 and $2,400 for full-time. Number of awards may vary. Renewable; maintain 3.0 GPA and demonstrated leadership in at least two college activities. more...

Leadership Activity Award-Transfer
Scholarship for undergraduate transfer students accepted to Maryville University full-time. Selection criteria based on 3.0 GPA, two letters of recommendation, and demonstrated leadership in at least two high school or community activities. Award amount for commuter students is $1,200 and $2,400 for full-time. Number of awards may vary. Renewable; maintain 3.0 GPA and demonstrated leadership in at least two college activities. more...

Leadership Award - Westminster College
The Leadership Award is available to incoming freshmen at Westminster College. You must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and at least a 21 ACT score (970 SAT) to be considered for this award. You must also have participated in extracurricular activities, volunteer work and church involvement. more...

Ling Li Memorial Graduate Scholarship
Ling Li was an international student from Mainland China. She was preparing for her doctoral dissertation in Education and planning to graduate in 2005 from the University of Missouri – St. Louis when she died in an automobile accident at the age of 31. Ling Li was interested in educational technology to support student learning and in cross cultural research in teacher preparation. She was the president of the Chinese Student Association-Mainland at UM-St. Louis where she dedicated herself to this organization and others. Ling Li was an open, passionate, and warm-hearted young woman and an outstanding young student who will be missed by many. Ling was awarded the Ph.D. in Education posthumously at a ceremony attended by members of her family.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients of this scholarship will be graduate students in the College of Education.
Preference will be given to doctoral students.
Candidates shall have a minimum GPA of 3.25 and be in good standing with the College of Education and the Graduate School. more...

Marcus Allen Memorial Scholarship
Dr. Allen was the first, and for many years the only, African-American faculty member at UM-St. Louis. Recruited as one of the young academics to build this new campus, he came to the university as head of the French section of the Department of Modem
Languages and Literatures and later was chairman for eight years. Dr. Allen taught French at the university for twenty years until his retirement in 1986.
As part of a post-doctoral Fulbright award, he spent several summers in France doing research as part of an international project on the works of Voltaire. Dr. Allen was awarded the Palmes Academiques in 1972, the highest award bestowed by France for services to the cause of Franco-American relations and for his scholarly research on Voltaire. In 1976, he received the AMOCO Foundation Excellence in Teaching Award. Additional information on Dr. Allen’s distinguished career is available in campus archives.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients will be undergraduate students who enroll full-time at UMSL (12 hours per semester).
Candidates must be pursuing a Bachelor of Modern Languages.
First preference will be given to students majoring in French.
In the absence of qualified candidates majoring in French, selection will be made from students majoring in one of the Romance languages.
Recipients will have earned a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.
This award will be based on merit. However, all things being equal, preference will be given to students who demonstrate financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). more...

Marie Morheuser Casey Scholarship In Education
This scholarship was inspired by the life work of Marie C. (Morheuser) Casey, who taught kindergarten, first and second grades for 19 years (1969-1988) in the City of St. Louis Public Schools, beginning when her youngest child was three years old. A native of North St. Louis, she graduated in 1939 from Blessed Sacrament Parish School, in 1943 from Incarnate Word Academy, and in 1947 from Webster College with a bachelor’s degree in sociology and a minor in physical education. In 1947 she joined the robust St. Louis City Parks recreation program and worked for more than three years on summer playgrounds and in winter community center programs, leading recreational and art programs for patrons. She volunteered to work at Mullanphy Park (10th and Cass in downtown SL Louis) when it became one of first three integrated parks in St. Louis in summer 1950.
She married Paul E. Casey in December 1950 and their seven daughters and one son were born in 1952 (Meg), 1953 (Marilyn), 1955 (Paul), 1956 (Marie), 1958 (Martha), 1959 (Mary), 1961 (Monica) and 1966 (Michelle). She instilled within her children a love of learning through daily reading aloud, summer school in the basement (with topics ranging from geography and mythology to art, music, and exercise), and every-other-week trips to the St. Louis County Library on Natural Bridge, which served their home community of Northwoods. In 1969 she enrolled in Career II, a federally-funded program implemented in St. Louis by St. Louis Public Schools Superintendent William A. Kottmeyer and Audrey E. Claus, who together co-authored the popular “Basic Goals in Spelling." Through the Career II program, Marie (Morheuser) Casey earned her certificate in teaching, practice taught at Clay Elementary in North St. Louis, and then devoted herself to mastering every available reading curriculum to ensure the reading and overall learning success of her young students at Mark Twain Elementary and Mark Twain Branch.
It is the hope of Marie A. Casey, her daughter, and her husband, Kenn Entringer, that this scholarship will contribute to the development of future teachers who are committed to the full development of children; especially those born into economic poverty. Those who carry on this commitment will share Marie (Morheuser) Casey’s wholehearted believe in the enormous potential within each child, her dedication to social justice, her inordinate sense of fairness and high ethics, and her believe that every day counts in the life of a child.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients must be Missouri residents.
Recipients will be undergraduate students at UMSL, pursuing a degree in the College of Education.
Recipients will demonstrate high financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Preference will be given to a non-traditional student coming back to college after raising a family to prepare for a career in the field of Education.
To the degree possible, scholarship awards will be made to graduate of the City of Saint Louis Public Schools. more...

Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA, financial need, be a parent and contribute personal funds toward their education. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Contact the School of Nursing for more information. more...

Recipients will demonstrate high financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Candidates must be undergraduate students who enroll full-time at UMSL (12 hours per semester).
Candidates will be Missouri residents. more...

Mcafee Scholarship
The McAfee Scholarship is available to full-time students at Park University. You must have a minimum GPA of 3.75 to be eligible for this renewable award. Additionally, it is recommended that you have a minimum ACT score of 28 or an SAT score of at least 1310. Selection is based on two letters of reference, personal statement, resume, and participation in the annual Park University Scholarship Day. This scholarship covers tuition for 144 undergraduate credit hours over four academic years and study abroad funds after first year in Honors Academy. more...

Mildred And Joan Scholarship In Education
Requirements:
Recipients shall be enrolled in a degree or teacher certification program within the College of Education at the University of Missouri – St. Louis
Recipients must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Preferences:
Preference will be given to a first-generation college student.
In order to achieve the benefits of a diverse student body, preference shall be given to a student from underrepresented minority group.
Should the University be unable to identify a student who meets all of the criteria stated herein, an award will be made to a student who most closely fits the above criteria. more...
