Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University, majoring in Physical Education. Applicant must be actively involved in Physical Education majors club, Honors Club or SENA and have participated in intramural, interscholastic or community athletic programs as a player, coach, teacher-coach, assistant coach, manager, or trainer. Candidate must demonstrate citizenship via school and community activities. Financial need is a primary consideration. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Students must have an ACT score of 21 or above; a minimum 3.0 GPA; and demonstrated performance in academic and extracurricular or co-curricular activities. Student must submit the Minority Mentor Program Application to be considered. Award is renewable for a second year upon mutual agreement of both student and participating department. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

Missouri & Foundation Leadership Scholarships
Scholarship for incoming freshmen accepted at Southeast Missouri State University full-time. Applicants must meet all the following criteria: 1) have a GPA of 3.0; 2) demonstrate a combination of grades, test scores and involvement in extracurricular activites; 3) maintain full-time enrollment status; and 4) live in the Universitys residence halls. Student must submit Application for Undergraduate Admission and Merit Scholarships and the Scholarship for Student Involvement/Award application to be considered. Number of awards varies. more...

Missouri Association Of Mutual Insurance Companies Insurance Scholarship
Annual award for Missouri resident who is an undergraduate junior or senior student attending Missouri State University full-time, majoring in Insurance and Risk Management. Preference given to a student NOT purusing actuarial career. Preference also given to student with financial need who has insurance internship, work experience in insurance or active membership in Gamma lota Sigma. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and must have completed one insurance and risk management course with continued enrollment in advanced insurance and risk management courses. Student must show leadership and character, including trustworthiness and reliability. Renewable; must reapply. more...

Missouri College Guarantee Program Scholarship
Scholarship for Missouri residents who are undergraduate or graduate transfer students enrolled full-time at Park University. Students must have a minimum 2.5 GPA, a minimum 20 ACT score or a minimum 950 SAT score, financial need, be U.S. citizens/permanent residents, and participate in extracurricular activities. Award amount and number of awards may vary. A FAFSA must be included with application packet. more...

Applicant must be deserving and show promise of leadership and academic ability in the field of Agriculture. Candidate, or a member of the applicants family, must be a member of the Missouri Farm Bureau. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Applicants must have attended either Missouri Girls or Boys State, have a minimum 3.0 GPA and live on campus or with parents. This is a one-time award. Student must submit the Application for Undergraduate Admission and Merit Scholarships, and the Scholarship for Student Involvement/Award Application to be considered. Number of awards varies. more...

Missouri Income Tax Credit Scholarship
Annual award for out-of-state undergraduate students attending Southeast Missouri State University who work or whose parents work in Missouri and pay Missouri income tax. All or a portion of the Missouri income tax paid may be used as a credit against the difference between in-state and out-of-state fees. Some awards by Southeast Missouri cannot be combined with the Missouri Income Tax Credit. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Missouri Motor Carriers Association Logistics & Transportation Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University full-time, majoring in Marketing with Logistics and Transportation. Student must have had an internship or employment in trucking industry. Applicant must have academic ability to successfully complete degree, as well as character and leadership. Renewable; must reapply. more...

Missouri Outreach Graduate Opportunity (Mogo) Scholarship
Scholarship for non-resident, graduate students attending Missouri State University in Missouri. Award has a value of three-fourths of the non-resident graduate student fees for 9 credit hours (5 credit hours in the summer). No application is necessary once the student meets the eligibility criteria. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

Missouri Public Risk Management Association Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student, who completed sophomore year, attending Missouri State University, majoring in Insurance and/or Risk Management. Student must have leadership through campus, community or other civic activities and work experience. Applicant must have character including trustworthiness and reliability. Submit faculty letter of recommendation with application packet. more...

Missouri River Auto Parts Scholarship
The Missouri River Auto Parts Scholarship is available to students at State Technical College of Missouri who are pursuing an Associate of Applied Science Degree at State Technical College of Missouri in Automotive Collision Technology, Automotive Technology, Aviation Maintenance, Caterpillar Dealer Service Technician Option, Electric Power Generation, Electronics Engineering Technology, Heavy Equipment Technology, Medium/Heavy Truck Technology, or Powersports Technology. You must have a minimum GPA of 2.5 and be enrolled on a full-time basis to be eligible for this award. Priority will be given to first-year students. more...

Missouri State Leadership Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen accepted at Missouri State University. Southwest Missouri high schools may recommend one student for every 100 graduates. Applicants must be nominated by counselor including schools in the following counties: Barry, Barton, Cedar, Christian, Dade, Dallas, Douglas, Greene, Howell, Jasper, Laclede, Lawrence, McDonald, Newton, Oregon, Ozark, Polk, Shannon, Stone, Taney, Texas, Vernon, Webster and Wright. Number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University full- or part-time, majoring in Nursing. Preference given to a student involved in the Missouri State Nurses Association. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Consideration given for financial need and leadership qualities. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Missouri State Society Daughters Of The American Revolution Scholarship
All applicants must be citizens of the United States and must attend or plan to attend an accredited college or university in the United States. DAR chapter sponsorship is not required; however, a chapter or state chairman may work with the applicant to put the information together to send to the DAR Scholarship Committee. Please see website for deadlines and for instructions on how to apply. Please click VISIT at the bottom of the page to be taken to website. more...

Missouri Valley College Dance Scholarship
All students that make the dance team will automatically be eligible to receive a portion of the scholarhip offered. They cannot receive any other school scholarship in conjuction with this scholarship. Tryouts for 2012-2013 are August 28th from 7-9pm . Results from tryouts will be announced at tryouts. more...

Monsanto Minority Math And Science Scholarship
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates for this scholarship will be incoming freshmen who are from disadvantaged minority groups (specifically, Black, Native American, Puerto Rican, or Mexican American).
Candidates must be admitted to UMSL and be majoring in biology, chemistry, physics, math, computer science, or engineering.
Candidates must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Preference will be given to students who have successfully completed the Bridge Program. more...

Recipients will be graduates of the Bridge Program who have been admitted to a UMSL and are pursuing a graduate degree. more...

Candidates will be pursuing coursework leading to teacher certification in science education.
Recipients must be undergraduate Missouri residents.
Recipients must demonstrate high financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). more...

Nancy S. Abel Scholarship
Nancy S. Abel always wished that she had gone to college. When she was a young girl in the 1940s, the opportunities for someone like her living in a small town were very few. She wanted so much more for her own children and pushed them hard to excel in school so that they could go to college. The Abel family was very lucky and able to send all three of their children to the college of their choice. This scholarship is in honor of their mother, Nancy. She would be so happy to know that a deserving student will be able to attend UMSL.
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be incoming freshmen at UMSL, who intends to major in any discipline within the College of Arts & Sciences.
Candidates will have a cumulative high school GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Preference will be given to applicants who complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Recipients must enroll in at least 12 credit hours at UMSL (full-time) each semester. more...

Naomi Sago Oelsen Interior Design Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Southeast Missouri State University, majoring in Interior Design. Applicants must have excellent academic performance demonstrated by a 3.0 GPA and financial need. Due dates are July 2 (fall) and March 1 (spring). more...

Due date and award amount varies. more...

Nisa Investment Advisors Scholarship
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be undergraduate students at UMSL who are majoring in finance.
Candidates will have earned a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher.
Candidates will be juniors or seniors who have completed Financial Management (FIN 3500) and at least two of the following courses:
Investments
Advanced Financial Management
Options, Futures, and Derivative Securities
Fixed Income
International Financial Management
Other upper-level finance courses. more...

Nora Farley Ames & David D. Farley Scholarship Program At The University Of Missouri System
An endowed scholarship program was established at the University of Missouri System (UM) from the
estate of Nora B. Ames. This scholarship program provides awards that are funded from the Nora Farley
Ames and David D. Farley Education Fund, that is held by the University to serve high school graduates
from Public high schools located in Buchanan, Cass, Clay, DeKalb, Jackson, Johnson or Platte counties in
the State of Missouri. All students who receive funding from the Nora Farley Ames and David D. Farley
Scholarship Program must enroll in 12 or more credit hours each semester; maintain a 2.5 grade point
average the first semester they enroll at an UM campus and a 3.0 grade point average each semester
thereafter; and by the end of the 4th semester, have in writing a planned program leading to a definite
degree signed by the student’s faculty advisor. Initial awards are given to successful applicants who rank
in the upper twenty-five percent of their high school class or have a composite score of at least 24 on an
ACT exam.
Scholarship Criteria
Be admissible to one of the four campuses of the University of Missouri
Have a high school class rank of at least 75% or above or have an ACT composite
score of 24 or above
Have financial need at the UM campus the applicant will attend, as measured by
the FAFSA filed that academic year.
Please contact the University of Missouri Office of Student Financial Aid for information on how to apply. Please click VISIT button at the bottom of the page to be taken to the University of Missouri Office of Student Financial Aid website. more...

Opportunity Scholars Program
The Opportunity Scholars Program provides a unique opportunity for St. Louis-area high school students to receive an all-inclusive, four-year scholarship to the University of Missouri–St. Louis, and opportunities to develop career experience. Interested candidates will need to meet the following general guidelines:
1) Candidates must be graduates of high schools in the St. Louis Metropolitan Area;
2) Current high school seniors, starting college in the Fall Semester following the application deadline, who meet 2 of these 3 criteria:
Rank in top 10% of high school class,
Have earned a 3.5 cumulative high school GPA,
Have a composite score of 26 or higher on the ACT (or SAT equivalent);
3) Demonstrated involvement and potential for leadership through extracurricular activities or community service.
4) Preference will be given to first-generation college students and/or underrepresented students.
For a detailed list of criteria and applications deadlines, or for more information about the program in general, please visit the Opportunity Scholars Program web site. more...

Optometry Scholarship
Scholarship for Kansas residents who are graduate students attending the Missouri School of Optometry, University of Missouri in St. Louis, Missouri or Southern College of Optometry in Memphis, Tennesse or School of Optometry at Northeastern State University, in Tahlequah, Oklahoma pursuing studies in Optometry. Students attending school in Tennessee or Oklahoma must provide service as an Optometrist in Kansas one year for each year of scholarship support. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Out-Of-State Fee Stipend Midwest Student Exchange Scholarship Program
Scholarship for non-resident, incoming freshmen accepted at Missouri State University. Applicants must rank in the top 25% of their graduating class, have a minimum 3.5 GPA, and have a minimum ACT score of 24. Qualified residents of Kansas, Michigan, Minnesota, Nebraska, or North Dakota will receive the Midwest Student Exchange award; other qualified non-Missouri residents will receive the out-of-state fee stipend. Number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

Out-Of-State Fee Waiver/Midwest Student Exchange Program
The Out-of-State Fee Waiver/Midwest Student Exchange Program is open to non-resident entering freshmen at Missouri State University. You must have either a minimum 24 ACT / 1180 SAT score, a minimum 3.5 GPA, or rank in the top 25 percent of your class to be eligible for this award. more...

Out-Of-State Fee Waiver/Midwest Student Exchange Program
The Out-of-State Fee Waiver/Midwest Student Exchange Program is open to students transferring from a community college to Missouri State University. You must be a non-resident, entering transfer student who has completed at least 24 hours with a 3.25 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

When awarded to a freshman, selection based on high school performance, college potential, and leadership. When awarded to a sophomore or above, student must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Annual award for a Missouri resident who is a graduating high school senior from Pattonville High School that plans to attend Webster University. Applicant must have a minimum 3.4 GPA, rank in the top 20% of their class and have an ACT score of 24 or above or an SAT score of 1100 or above. Submit a recommendation from candidates high school principal and/or guidance counselor with application packet. more...

Number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable. more...

Peter W. And Helen M. Goode Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Missouri State Senator Wayne Goode and his family in honor of Senator Goode’s parents. This generous fund is meant to assist the college in attracting highly qualified and diverse applicants from Missouri high schools.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients must be enrolled full-time at UMSL (12 hours each semester).
Recipients must be undergraduate students in the Pierre Laclede Honors College.
Recipients will reflect the racial, ethnic, and cultural diversity of the St. Louis community. At least fifty percent of the recipients will be female students.
Whenever possible, recipients will be traditional college students who are Missouri residents.
Recipients will possess and demonstrate leadership ability and shall have evidence of significant contributions to the community.
Preference will be given to incoming freshmen who rank in the top ten percent of their high school class and who have achieved scores on the ACT or SAT in the top fifteen percent of Missouri students.
Consideration (but not preference) will be given to candidates who complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Recipients must remain in good standing with the Pierre Laclede Honors College, including progression through the curriculum and a cumulative GPA of 3.2 or higher. more...

Pettijohn Excellence In Retailing Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University, majoring in Marketing. Award amount varies. more...

Applicant must have completed 12 hours of history courses with a minimum overall GPA of 3.2 and have a 3.0 GPA in two-thirds of all non-history course work. Recipient must be enrolled for nine hours if an undergraduate and six hours if a graduate student. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Point Foundation Scholarship
Point Foundation (Point) is the nation’s largest higher education scholarship-granting organization for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ) students. Point’s multifaceted support of its scholarship recipients (“scholars”) extends far beyond direct financial contribution toward the cost of their education. Each scholar is paired with a mentor and participates in leadership development programs and events.
Point Foundation considers many factors when assessing scholarship applicants, including:
A proven track record of leadership and community involvement
Strong academic achievement
Working for the betterment of the LGBTQ community
Financial need
To apply, please click on the VISIT button at the bottom of the page. more...

Police Scanner Radio Scholarship Contest
Write a 500+ word essay about anything police scanner related. There is no wrong topic – topics could include:
› How police scanners are used
› A story about police scanners
› The future of police scanners
› Police scanners and the media
› Anything – as long as it’s related to police scanners
The Zip Scanners team will review all submissions and choose finalists to be part of the contest. Finalists will be chosen based on submitting correctly (format, title, length, etc.), originality, grammar and our personal preferences.
To apply for this opportunity, please visit the URL provided below. more...

Proud To Be First Scholars Program
In Honor of Susan Feigenbaum, Sharon G. Levin and Blanche M. Touhill, the Proud to Be First Scholars Program aims to enhance opportunities for first-generation UMSL students.*
Dr. Susan Feigenbaum is quick to point out the tremendous impact mentors have made on her life. As a first-generation college student, she was especially grateful to acquire such compassionate guides through her college experience. As much as her parents tried to prepare her for life away from home, they couldn’t adequately convey a sense of the requirements and challenges inherent in completing a college degree, as they hadn’t experienced it.
As a young economics professor at the University of Missouri–St. Louis in the late 1980s, Feigenbaum made it her mission to mentor as many students as she could during her 30 years teaching at UMSL. In light of her passion for helping First Generation college students navigate their way through higher education, Dr. Feigenbaum established this program to help connect first-generation UMSL students with dedicated mentors to help guide them through their four years at UMSL.
The Proud to Be First (PBF) Scholars Program celebrates the on-going journey of students whose parent did not graduate from college. The PBF Scholars program seeks to provide a high-profile, high-touch prestigious opportunity to these “first-generation” college students through a faculty Mentorship program that emphasizes the development of at least one meaningful relationship with University of Missouri – St. Louis faculty. This program will empower students to overcome obstacles to degree completion commonly faced by first-generation college students.
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be incoming First Time Freshman
Candidates will be First Generation College students
Candidates must have a minimum High School Core GPA of 3.0 and a minimum of 22 ACT/ or SAT Equivalent more...

Public Accounting Scholarships
Scholarship for incoming undergraduate students attending Loyola University Chicago who will be majoring in Accounting. Selection based on academic achievement. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Purdy Emerging Leaders Scholarship
The Purdy Emerging Leaders Scholarship from the Missouri Scholarship & Loan Foundation is named after Allan Walker Purdy. This program provides merit-based scholarships to emerging leaders who are outstanding students and who have the need for additional resources for higher education.
Applicants will be evaluated on the basis of academic performance, leadership potential, and character. Selected students will be those who have a vision, are eager to make their contribution to the world, and have the work ethic to bring their dreams to fruition. Unmet financial need will also be considered as scholarship funds are intended to be used for tuition, fees, and course-related expenses, including books, supplies and equipment.
Eligibility
PUBLIC
GPA
Award recipients will be notified in mid-July.
Questions? Contact Melissa Findley, Missouri Scholarship & Loan Foundation, at INFO@MOSLF.org
The Missouri Scholarship & Loan Foundation does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, creed, national origin, gender, age, color, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability.

Richard Earl "Dick" Davis Family Memorial Scholarship
Dick. the first of six children, was born on November 28, 1938, in Kansas City, Missouri. At the age or six his father was drafted into the armed forces, so he and his family relocated to his mother’s family homestead established in Henry County in rural western Missouri. His life was nurtured within a farming community that valued faith, family, personal responsibility and charity. His formal early education took place in a one-room school house prior to entry into high school at the age of twelve. Gifted with many natural abilities, a drive to acquire knowledge—he completed a correspondence course in electronics at age fourteen—and an aptitude for how things work, one of his first jobs off the farm was in radio and television repair. Soon he moved to Illinois in order to pursue a career in the rapidly expanding telecommunications industry. Throughout life he embraced each new opportunity with skill, high expectations and determination. Those characteristics were, without a doubt, instrumental for his academic achievements as a “non-traditional” college student – married with two boys ages nine and seven.
Among Dick’s most notable endeavors was his success as an adult learner with a family in the midst of life’s everyday challenges. Lacking the resources to purse higher education in the late 1960s, Dick competed for and was awarded a scholarship from the IBEW and tuition aid from his employer Illinois Bell Telephone Company (now AT&T). That launched him on the path to a remarkable college experience. He completed the rigorous engineering curriculum at Bradley University located in Peoria, Illinois over the course of just four years plus one summer, was awarded high honors at commencement and recognized by his peers as the 1972 Outstanding Senior Engineering Student. Through it all he was also recognized for having perfect attendance at work. As the breadwinner with a stay at home spouse, day after day he worked full-time from 4:00 p.m. to midnight, slept a few hours, attended classes, studied, and even found time to hang out with his two sons. In addition, having an uncompromising sense of duty to provide for his family and lacking an appreciation for idleness, during a prolonged contentious strike at Illinois Bell he earned minimum wage while cleaning a local park. Clearly, his actions and attitude authenticated a familiar phrase that he repeated often, “I do not have to go to work, I get to go to work.”
Dick was licensed as a Professional Engineer (P.E.) in 1989. Following a thirty-four year career at Illinois Bell Telephone Co., he worked several years at Communications Engineers in Springfield, Illinois. He maintained a commitment to self-reliance throughout his life which led him to perform most household improvements and automobile repairs. His passion to create inspired numerous woodworking and electronic projects and the assembly of two experimental aircraft, one which he completed and enjoyed piloting many hours prior to his death on June 19, 2006, at the age of 67.
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients will be Missouri residents as well as US citizens or permanent residents.
Recipients must be undergraduate students pursuing a degree in the Joint Engineering Program.
Recipients must demonstrate high financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Recipients must have completed 60 or more credit hours toward an engineering degree and be in good academic standing.
Preference will be given to non-traditional students with one or more dependent children. more...

Richard Haswell Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate senior (expected to graduate within two semesters) attending Missouri State University, majoring in English. Preference will be given to students who intend to pursue graduate studies. Applicant must have a minimum 3.5 GPA. Consideration given for financial need. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Annual award for incoming freshman attending Missouri State University, majoring in English. Applicant must have a high school GPA of 2.5 and a 3.0 GPA in English. Selection will be based on high school performance, college potential and leadership qualities. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Rn To Bsn/Msn Challenge Scholarship

Their dedication to the well-being of others is truly commendable. If you are a Registered Nurse (RN) working towards your Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) or Master of Science in Nursing (MSN) – we want to support you. RegisteredNursing.org offers an annual $1,000 scholarship to help nurses continue their education. To see more details or apply, please click the VISIT button below to be taken to RegisteredNursing.org’s webiste. more...

Scholarships For Hispanic And Latino Students
Scholarship is a monetary gift for students to use for funding their post-secondary education. Scholarships do not need to be paid back, making them a desirable alternative to student loans. Scholarships may be used to pay for education-related costs including tuition, books, and other course materials. Some scholarships may also be used to cover food, room-and-board, laundry, and day-to-day expenses.
Thousands of different scholarships are available. Merit-based scholarships are typically given to students with high GPAs or an extensive record of community service. Other scholarships may be allotted to certain groups of people, including women or minority students. There are also scholarship options for students who demonstrate financial need.
In order to qualify for most scholarships, students must first complete an application. While the nature of these applications will vary by award, most will include the following general criteria:
To see more informational about external scholarships for Hispanic and Latino students, please click the VISIT button at the bottom of the page. more...

Selfscore International Student Scholarship
As former international students, we understand the journey that your foreign students take to study in the US. And we are proud to announce the SelfScore Scholarship for International Students to help these bright and brave students achieve their goals.
Six undergraduate students and six graduate students will be selected randomly from the pool of eligible applicants. All applicants will receive a Free Financial Literacy program. And scholarship recipients will receive their awards through their university in February 2017.
The application deadline is November 15, 2016. So please share this opportunity with the international students at your university. To apply please click the VISIT button at the bottom of the page. more...

Selonick Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Cincinnati College of Business majoring in Real Estate. Students must be pursuing a real estate career. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Semo Press Association Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Bollinger, Butler, Cape Girardeau, Carter, Crawford, Dunklin, Iron, Jefferson, Madison, Mississippi, New Madrid, Pemiscot, Perry, Reynolds, Ripley, St. Francois, Ste. Genevieve, Scott, Stoddard, Washington, or Wayne county, Missouri who are undergraduate students attending Southeast Missouri State University, majoring in Mass Communication with an emphasis in Print Journalism. Selection is based on GPA and related activities. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Semo Visual And Performing Arts Scholarship
The SEMO Visual and Performing Arts Scholarship is available to incoming freshman and transfer students at Southeast Missouri State University. You must be majoring in art, theatre, or dance to be eligible for this renewable award. Additionally, you must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 combined with a minimum ACT score of 21 or a minimum SAT score of 1060. more...

Semple Scholarship
Scholarship for graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Cincinnati majoring in Classics. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Senator John Dennis-Scott County Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Scott County, Missouri who are undergraduate students attending Southeast Missouri State University. Applicants must have a minimum 2.75 GPA and demonstrated financial need. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Senior Citizen Discount Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at Park University. Award is to audit classes at no cost at Parkville Daytime classes only. Number of awards may vary. Award amount is for 10% of tuition. more...

Senior Class Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate seniors attending Southeast Missouri State University. Applicants must have a minimum of 89 credit hours. Financial need and GPA may be determining factors. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Sergeant Major Stan Hillery (Ret.) Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled at Park University. Applicants must be Camp Pendleton students. Due date may vary. more...

Shannon Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time graduate students attending Saint Louis University majoring in Physics. Applicants must have financial need and contribute personal funds toward their education. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Contact the Office of Financial Aid for more information. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Southeast Missouri State University, enrolling in the School of Visual and Performing Arts. Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA or higher and verified financial need. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Shirley A. Martin Nursing Scholarship
Candidates will be undergraduates majoring in the College of Nursing.
Candidates must be enrolled full-time each semester at UMSL (12 hours per semester).
Applicants must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Recipients will demonstrate high financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Preference will be given to incoming Freshman more...

Shirley Ann Watson Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for juniors or seniors attending Truman State University who are majoring in Mathematics with an emphasis to teach. Selection based on academic achievement, minimum 3.0 GPA, financial need and potential. Applicants must be natural U.S. citzens. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Shirley Frye Cummins Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate senior attending Missouri State University, who has enrolled in graduate school for the ensuing year, majoring in Physical Education. Applicant must have a minimum CGPA of 2.75 with a 2.9 GPA in Physical Education. Candidate must be actively involved in Physical Education majors/honors club, participate in intramural or intrascholastic or community athletic programs and demonstrate citizenship via school and community activities. Consideration given for financial need. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Shutterfly Business Scholarship
Requirements:
•18 years old at the time of application
•Proof of business major
•Must have completed primary, middle and high school in the United States
•No personal, identifying information on your essay, including ethnic background, race, city, state or country of birth
•Write a minimum 600-800 maximum word essay on the required topic (see below)
•Applicants cannot be related to an employee of Shutterfly or any of its related companies more...

Requirements:
•18 years old at the time of application
•Proof of graphic design major
•Must have completed primary, middle and high school in the United States
•No personal, identifying information on your essay, including ethnic background, race, city, state or country of birth
•Write a minimum 600-800 maximum word essay on the required topic (see below)
•Applicants cannot be related to an employee of Shutterfly or any of its related companies more...

Applicants must have completed nine credit hours at SAHEC, have good moral character and a minimum 2.0 GPA (or 2.5 if current student at SAHEC). Submit essay with application packet. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Southeast A+ Scholarship
Scholarship for entering freshmen attending Southeast Missouri State Universitys (KAHEC) Kennett Area Higher Education Center full-time. Applicant must submit FAFSA application. Student must submit $20 application fee, high school transcript and ACT/SAT scores and complete the financial aid process as directed by Student Financial Services. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Southeast Ace Scholars Scholarship
Scholarship for Missouri residents who are incoming freshmen accepted at Southeast Missouri State University. Applicants must have participated in the ACE (Accelerated College Education Scholars) Program which allows students to earn up to 30 credit hours while still in high school. Student must earn a minimum of 18 credit hours with a cumulative University GPA of 3.5 or higher. To participate in the ACE program, must be a high school sophomore or above with a GPA of 3.0 and be recommended by counselor or high school principal. Due date and number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

Special Opportunity Achievement Academic Award - Jefferson College
The Special Opportunity Achievement Academic Award is available to students at Jefferson College. You must have ranked in the top half of your graduating class or have achieved a minimum GED test score of 2800. You must also be from a disadvantaged socio-economic background. Preference is given to students participating in the Jefferson College Student Support Services Program, Project Success, or to students with financial need. more...

Applicant must show leadership in 2 of 3 areas: campus, community and/or professional activities. Attendance at a state, district and National Athletic Training professional conference is required. Due date and award amount varies. more...

St. John The Baptist Scholarship
Scholarship for Missouri residents who are graduating high school seniors from St. John the Baptist High School that plan to attend Webster University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.4 GPA, rank in the top 20% of their class and have an ACT score of 24 or above or an SAT score of 1100 or above. Submit a recommendation from candidates high school principal and/or guidance counselor with application packet. Number of awards varies. more...

St. John Vianney High School Scholarship
Scholarship for Missouri residents who are graduating high school seniors from St. John Vianney High School that plan to attend Webster University. Applicants must have a minimum 4.25 GPA, and have an ACT score of 24 or above or an SAT score of 1100 or above. Number of awards varies. more...

St. Louis Chapter 17 Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students enrolled in select Missouri and Illinois colleges who are student members of the SME St. Louis Chapter 17 and are majoring in Manufacturing Engineering, Industrial Technology or related fields. Undergraduate students must have a minimum 3.5 GPA and graduating high school seniors must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. College juniors and seniors must be enrolled at the University of Missouri-Rolla, Southeast Missouri State University-Cape Girardeau, or Southern Illinois University-Carbondale. College freshmen or sophomores may attend Jefferson College, Mineral Area College or St. Louis Community College-Florissant Valley and then transfer to one of the above four year institutions. Nonrenewable; but recipients may reapply annually. more...

Preference given to children of Southeast Missouri State University alumni. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Candidate must state if either or both parents are alumni of Southeast, dates of attendance and degree earned and submit with application packet. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Stanley And Lucy Lopata Excellence In Creativity Award
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be undergraduate students at UMSL who are majoring in the sciences.
Candidates will have earned a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher.
Preference will be given to incoming freshmen.
Preference will be given to students who rank in the top two positions in their respective categories in the Junior Science, Engineering, and Humanities Symposium (JSEHS). more...

Stanley And Terry Freerks Jubilee Opportunity Scholarship
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be Missouri residents.
Candidates must be undergraduate students who enroll full-time at UMSL (12 hours per semester).
Recipients will demonstrate high financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Recipients will be participants in the UMSL Opportunity Scholars Program.
To apply for this scholarship, students must complete the application for the Opportunity Scholars Program. more...

Stanley And Terry Freerks Scholarship
Stan and Terry Freerks feel that UMSL is a quality and vital institution: their desire is to provide opportunities for others to enjoy what UMSL has to offer. Terry believes that education is foundational to a productive and enjoyable life, and she and Stan both believe that athletic involvement complements those pursuits.
Terry received her BA in History and her MA in Education from UM-St. Louis. It was in the UMSL environment that she realized her love of academics and her desire to continue her studies. Terry received her PhD. in Counseling from St. Louis University. Terry attributes the academic preparation and professorial guidance from the UMSL faculty for her decision to seek her Doctorate. While at UMSL, Terry profited from the tutelage and mentoring of then History Professor Blanche Touhill, who became Chancellor of UMSL, where Terry experienced Dr. Touhill dedicating herself to the development and well-being of the UMSL students and university. Terry wanted to follow that example by giving back to the school that was so vital to her success as a professional and as a person. Terry has her own private practice in counseling and is the Executive Director of the Clayton Shaw Park Swim Team.
Stan received his MBA from UMSL after having completed his undergraduate degree in History from Cornell University. Stan founded his own wholesale insurance brokerage firm in St. Louis in 1979 and continues the practice today. Stan feels that his business studies at UMSL prepared him for the demands of his position as CEO and CFO of his business and contributed to his ability to successfully grow his business.
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be pursuing a degree in History at the undergraduate or graduate level.
If the recipient is an incoming freshman, she or he must have earned a cumulative high school GPA of 3.2 or higher. If the recipient is already an undergraduate or graduate student, she or he must have earned a cumulative UMSL GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Recipients must enroll full-time at UMSL each semester (12 hours per semester for undergraduate students and 9 hours per semester for graduate students).
Preference will be given to student’s involved in athletics or with demonstrated involvement in the community. more...

Stanley M. Burgess Graduate Religious Studies Scholarship
Annual award for graduate student attending Missouri State University full or part-time, majoring in Religious Studies. When awarded to a first-semester graduate student, applicant must have an overall GPA of at least 3.5. When awarded to a returning graduate student, applicant must have a minimum 3.5 GPA in all graduate work. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Stanlie H. & Belva Ross Spangler Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University, majoring in Agriculture. When awarded to an incoming freshman, selection based on high school performance, college potential and leadership qualities. When awarded to a student at the sophomore level or higher, student must have maintained an overall GPA of 3.0 and a 3.0 GPA in Agriculture. Consideration given for financial need. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University full-time, majoring in Insurance and Risk Management. Applicant must have completed one insurance and risk management course and have continued current enrollment in advanced insurance and risk management courses. Student must have a miminum 2.75 GPA;leadership shown through campus, community or other civic activities; work experience; and dedication to pursue an insurance career through active membership in Gamma lota Sigma. Renewable; must reapply. more...

Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University, who is a member of the intercollegiate varsity soccer program. Preference given first to Springfield high school graduates; and then to southwest Missouri residents or Missouri residents. When awarded to a freshman, selection based on high school performance, college potential and leadership. When awarded to a sophomore or above, student must have maintained an overall GPA of at least 2.5. Student must play in the position of defender. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Steve Wright-Cape Girardeau Noon Optimist Club Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Southeast Missouri State University. Applicants must meet one of the following criteria: 1) graduated from a Cape Girardeau County High School; 2) is a Cape County resident with a valid High School Equivalency Diploma; or 3) is a son or daughter of a current Cape Girardeau noon Optimist Member. Candidates should have high moral character and be law-abiding. Student must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and must have completed 12 credit hours. Submit two letters of recommendation from non-family members with application packet. more...

Candidate must demonstrate leadership and character through participation in Lambda Rho activities. Due date varies. more...

Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University, majoring in Sports Medicine or Athletic Training. Applicant must have clinical evaluation of at least 3.0 in all clinical assignments and a cumulative GPA of at least 3.5 in all sports medicine or athletic training coursework. Candidate must attend two MoATA, MAATA, or NATA national conferences, with at least two conferences in two different categories. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Terry Perkins Scholarship

The Barry J. Nace “Pursuit Of Justice” Scholarship
During his extraordinary career dedicated to pursuing justice for those not able to fight for themselves, Paulson & Nace, PLLC founding partner Barry J. Nace has litigated scores of groundbreaking cases throughout the country at every level of the court system. One of his cases, Daubert v. Merrell Dow Pharmaceuticals, Inc., in which the Supreme Court eased the standard for the admissibility of expert testimony, has generated more than 100 articles, newsletters, and websites devoted to an ongoing discussion of this landmark decision.
Barry’s sons Christopher, Jonathan and Matthew Nace have all followed in his footsteps, becoming established trial attorneys in the area of medical malpractice and personal injury law. Paulson & Nace, PLLC would like to reward one lucky student with a chance to follow in Barry Nace’s footsteps. This individual should have a very strong passion for civil justice and see a future in the field. Please see below for criteria and how to apply for The Barry J. Nace “Pursuit of Justice” Scholarship.
Requirements
Applicant must already be accepted into an undergraduate program at a university or college.
Strong passion for civil justice
Why do you require financial help? What would the $5,000 would be spent on? (Tuition, Housing, Books, Etc.)
What drives your pursuit for civil justice? (Under 300 words please.)
Please click the VISIT button at the bottom of this page to apply. more...

The Diamond Herbs Scholarship Award
The $1000 scholarship aims to help students reach their education and career goals by assisting with the cost of tuition and books. We gladly welcome any student currently enrolled in school with a GPA of 3.0. To apply; the student must write an essay of the benefits of alternative medicine compared to pharmaceutical drugs. Any current student enrolled in an accredited U.S. college or university is welcome to apply. more...

The Hispanic Educational, Cultural And Scholarship Fund
The Hispanic Educational, Cultural and Scholarship Fund is pleased to award scholarships of $1,000 to Latino students in college or college-bound every year. These scholarships are recognition of a student’s overall achievements, and are available to Hispanic/Latino students that are permanent residents in the Greater St. Louis area (includes Missouri and Illinois) enrolled in post-secondary course work or trade school every fall.
For the purpose of this scholarship and to qualify, at least one of the applicant’s grandparents must be or have been Hispanic/Latino. Members of the board of directors of Hispanic ECS Fund and their relatives cannot be applicants.
In order to enter the selection process the completed application must be received by May 31, every year. Next scholarship program will be available in 2017. The scholarships are presented during the event sponsored by Hispanic Scholarship Alliance of St. Louis scheduled to be held on the last Friday, of July every year.
To see more information and to apply, please click the VISIT button at the bottom of the page. more...

The Horatio Alger Honeywell Scholarship
The Horatio Alger Honeywell Scholarship Program provides financial assistance to students who are pursuing degrees in the fields of science, technology, engineering or math (STEM). Each year ten scholarships, valued at $10,000 each, will be awarded to
deserving students from Honeywell Partner Schools or Horatio Alger Collegiate Partner institutions (See website for list of schools).
Eligibility:
The students selected for the Horatio Alger Honeywell Scholarship will exhibit the following characteristics:
• Attendance at a Honeywell Partner School or Horatio Alger Collegiate Partner institution and have
completed one semester in freshman year (entering sophomore year in Fall 2017)
• Pursuit of a degree in a STEM field
• Critical financial need ($55,000 or less family income)
• Integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity
• Academic achievement (minimum cumulative grade point average is 3.0 for consideration)
• United States citizenship
Please click VISIT to be taken to the Horatio Alger Website for more information and to apply. more...

The Izenda Embedded Bi & Analytics Scholarship
The Izenda Embedded BI & Analytics Scholarship is a selective $1,000 scholarship for outstanding undergraduate or graduate students. Founded in 2015, the scholarship awards one student a year pursuing a career in leveraging analytics to improve decision making and outcomes in the U.S. The scholarship was established with the intent of promoting students’ academic excellence and providing them the opportunity to reach their full potential.
Eligibility Requirements
• This scholarship is open to undergraduate or graduate student currently enrolled in an accredited U.S. college or university.
• Applicants must be a US citizen, national, or permanent resident.
• The work you submit should be entirely your own. Do not submit coursework you were assigned in a class you have taken.
For additional information and to apply, please click on the VISIT button to be take to donor’s website. more...

Recipients will be selected on the bases of merit and need.
Recipients must enroll at UMSL full-time each semester. more...

Scholarship Criteria
Recipients of this scholarship shall be African-American students who live in the St. Louis metropolitan area.
Candidates must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Recipients shall have demonstrated some leadership abilities at work or in school activities, clubs, organizations, or the community.
Recipients shall be first-time freshmen who have demonstrated academic promise.
Recipients must enroll full-time at UMSL (12 credit hours) each semester. more...

The Sigma Aldrich Scholarships

Recipients must enroll full-time to receive this scholarship. more...

The Smith Family Backstoppers Scholarship At Umsl
The Backstoppers was established by St. Louis area business and civic leaders and its mission is to provide the families of fallen police officers, firefighters, and paramedics/EMTs with the support they need to meet their financial obligations and continue to pursue their family’s dreams. One of the most important commitments The BackStoppers makes to survivor families is an assurance that their children will be able to afford whatever educational opportunities they have or that their parents had planned for them. Meeting these educational costs is often one of the major expenses for surviving families, and one of the most important. The Smith family established this scholarship to assist Backstoppers recipient families with educational expenses at UMSL.
Scholarship Criteria
Candidates will be Missouri residents.
Recipients will demonstrate high financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Incoming freshmen will be considered for this scholarship.
Preference will be given in this order of consideration:
Children/dependents/spouses of police, fire, or EMS personnel killed in the line of duty or individuals/dependents of those who have suffered a catastrophic injury;
Grandchildren of police, fire,or EMS personnel killed in the line of duty or who suffered a catastrophic injury;
Children of active/retired police, fire, or EMS personnel;

UMSL students registered in the Criminology and Criminal Justice Program;
General UMSL students. more...

The Women Of At&T Foundation Endowed Scholarship
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients shall be enrolled as undergraduate students at UMSL.
Preference will be given to female students.
Candidates must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and demonstrate financial need.
Preference will be given to students who have graduated in the top 20% of their school class or who rank in the top 20% of national scoring tests (e.g., ACT or SAT).
Recipient must maintain a minimum GPA of 3.0.
Preference will be given to students who reside in the St. Louis metropolitan area. more...

Tillman Scholars Program
Founded in 2008, the Tillman Scholars Program supports our nation’s active-duty service members, veterans and military spouses by investing in their higher education. Since the program’s inception, the Foundation has invested over $6 million in scholarships for 347 scholars nationwide.
The scholarship covers educational expenses, including tuition and fees, books and living expenses. But scholars receive much more than just funding. Our program unites the best talent and leadership in the military to make a significant impact in the fields of medicine, law, business, policy, technology, education and the arts.Please click view button at bottom of page to be taken to website. See website for deadlines. more...

Recipient must have completed 24 hours with a minimum 3.0 GPA. Submit essay describing participation in organizations with application packet. Award amount varies. more...

Trustee Scholarship-Park University
The Trustee Scholarship is available to full-time students at Park University. You must have a minimum GPA of 3.7 to be eligible for this renewable award. Additionally, it is recommended that you have a minimum ACT score of 25 or an SAT score of at least 1200. Selection is based on two letters of reference, personal statement, resume, and participation in the annual Park University Scholarship Day. more...

You must meet one of the following criteria: have a minimum 20 ACT/950 SAT score, rank in the top half of your graduating class, or have a minimum 2.5 GPA through the first semester of your senior year (or of the your last academic experience, for transfer students). more...

Candidates must have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.5 across all previous college work.
Recipients must enroll full-time at UMSL (a minimum of 12 credit hours) to receive this scholarship.
Scholarship is renewable for up to 5 additional semesters, provided the recipient maintains a cumulative UMSL GPA of 3.5 or higher. more...

Umsl Dr. Donald Suggs Scholarship
The Dr. Donald Suggs Scholarship is designed to enhance recruitment and retention of academically talented undergraduate students that are typically under-represented in higher education. This scholarship is named to honor Dr. Donald M. Suggs, oral surgeon, newspaper publisher, patron of the arts and distinguished community leader. His contributions to the City of St. Louis and the State of Missouri are recognized and honored by the University of Missouri – Saint Louis (UMSL) with a scholarship that covers all resident undergraduate tuition and fees at UMSL.
Scholarship Criteria
1) Candidates must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) by January 1 and be Pell Grant eligible.
2) Candidates will be current high school seniors, starting college in the Fall Semester following the application deadline, who meet 2 of the 3 criteria listed below:
• Rank in top 10% of high school class
• Have earned a 3.5 cumulative high school GPA
• Have a composite score of 26 or higher on the ACT (or SAT equivalent)
3) Preference will be given to first-generation college students and/or underrepresented students.
4) Preference will be given to student that have demonstrated involvement and potential for leadership through extracurricular activities or community service.
5) Preference will be given to graduates of high schools in the St. Louis Metropolitan Area
6) Preference will be given to students who have participated in UMSL Bridge Program more...

Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, rank in the top 50% of the graduating high school class, a minimum 20 ACT score or a minimum 1000 SAT score, and financial need. An interview is required. A FAFSA must be submitted. Due date and number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. more...

Varsity Tutors Scholarship
Varsity Tutors holds a monthly $1,000 college scholarship contest where students must write an essay in response to a monthly prompt. Visitors to the Varsity Tutors scholarship webpage are able to vote via social media for submitted entries. The top five entries with the most votes are reviewed by Varsity Tutors at the end of the month and one winner is subsequently chosen to receive the $1,000 college scholarship. To apply, please click the VISIT button at the bottom of the page. more...

Vashti Swan Daap Minority Undergraduate Scholarship
Scholarship for minority freshmen or sophomores enrolled full-time at the University of Cincinnati College of Design, Architecture, Art and Planning School of Architecture and Interior Design. Students must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and financial need. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Veda Harnes Trust Fund Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Southeast Missouri State University, active in the fields of drama, entertainment and the performing arts. Award covers incidental fees. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Velna Cooper Brown Restricted Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending the Sikeston Area Higher Education Center (SAHEC) at Southeast Missouri State University, interested in music. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. Reneweable. more...

Vencil J. Bixler Professional Insurance Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate or graduate student attending Missouri State University, majoring in Insurance and Risk Management or Insurance minor. Preference given to active members of Gamma lota Sigma. Applicant must have completed one insurance and risk management course and continued current enrollment in advanced insurance and risk management courses. Candidate must have successful passage of one part of examination for one of these designations: CLU, ChFC, CPCU, or CFP. Student must be enrolled in 9 or more undergraduate hours or 6 or more graduate hours each semester. Applicant must have a minimum 2.75 undergraduate GPA or a 3.2 graduate GPA. Student must have demonstrated leadership. Renewable; must reapply. more...

Vermell Pattillo Keesler Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for female undergraduate student attending Missouri State University, who is a member of a womens intercollegiate athletic team. When awarded to a freshman, selection based on high school performance, college potential and leadership. When awarded to a sophomore or above, student must have maintained an overall GPA of 3.0. Consideration given for financial need. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Vernon L. Pruitt V.F.W. Scholarship
Annual award for Missouri resident that is an honorably discharged U.S. military veteran or the son/daughter of an honorably discharged U.S. military veteran who is an undergraduate student attending Southeast Missouri State University. Applicant must have completed 30 credit hours; have a minimum 2.5 GPA (and a 3.0 GPA in their major); and have financial need. Award amount varies. more...

Annual award for undergraduate sophomore or junior attending Missouri State University, majoring in Agriculture-related field. Preference given to Agronomy or Wild Conservation majors who have demonstrated an interest in Soil Conservation, Soil Science or Ecologically sustainable Agriculture. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Wells Fargo Advisors Opportunity Scholarship
Scholarship Criteria
Recipients must be incoming freshmen who are graduates of a St. Louis Public School district high school.
Preference will be given to graduating seniors of Vashon High School.
Students must have earned a 2.75 cumulative GPA in high school, have a minimum composite ACT score of 21 (or SAT equivalent), and rank in the top 25% of their senior high school class.
Financial need is not a requirement. However, all applicants must submit a valid FAFSA for consideration.
Recipients must enroll full-time at UMSL (12 hours each semester) to receive this scholarship. more...

Women's Council Student Scholarship
The Women's Council Student Scholarship is available to students attending Saint Louis University. more...

Wood Family Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of East Prairie, Missouri that graduated from any high school in the East Prairie School District and are undergraduate students attending Southeast Missouri State University. Applicants must have financial need and a minimum 2.75 GPA. Graduate students may apply; however, first preference given to undergraduate students. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Woodfin C. Garrett Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate sophomore, junior or senior attending Missouri State University full-time, majoring in Computer Information Systems. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 overall GPA and a minimum 3.2 GPA in Computer Information Systems courses. more...

Woodrow Sun Mathematics Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Missouri State University, majoring in Mathematics or Mathematics Education. When awarded to an incoming freshman, selection based on high school performance, college potential and leadership qualities. When awarded to a sophomore or above, student must have maintained an overall GPA of 3.0 and a GPA of 3.0 in their major. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Working Student Assistance Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students attending Southeast Missouri State University. Applicants must work on campus. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Writers Hall Of Fame Of America-Greater Kansas City Chapter Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Platte, Clay, Ray, Jackson, Lafayette, Cass, Johnson, Bates, or Henry counties, Missouri who are incoming freshmen students attending Missouri State University. High school seniors must participate in writing contests. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Wwu Lead Award
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending William Woods University. Recipients must sign a commitment to participate in LEAD activities at William Woods University. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Yates Fellows & Scholars Program
Annual Fellowships for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Cincinnati McMicken College of Arts and Sciences. Award amount is for full-tuition. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Zane Miller Prize
Scholarship for graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Cincinnati McMicken College of Arts and Sciences Department of History. This is a research paper contest. Award amounts are $125 for second runner up; $250 for first runner up; and $500 for 1st place. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Zolp Scholarships
Scholarship for incoming undergraduate students enrolling at Loyola University Chicago whose last name is Zolp and are of the Catholic faith. Applicants last name of Zolp must appear on birth certificate and confirmation certificate. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Zonta Club Of St. Louis Scholarship For Women In Science
The Zonta Club of St. Louis Scholarship for Women in Science is available to female science majors enrolled in the Saint Louis University, College of Arts and Sciences. more...

Zonta Club Scholarship
Scholarship for female non-traditional undergraduates attending Southeast Missouri State University. Applicants must have financial need and a minimum 2.0 GPA on previous college work. Requires separate application. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Zora & Jerline Dossett Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students (enrolled in their last semester or senior year) attending Southeast Missouri State University, majoring in Education. Applicants must have a minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Zora And Jerline Dossett Memorial Scholarship
The Zora and Jerline Dossett Memorial Scholarship is available to seniors at Southeast Missouri State University. You must be majoring in elementary education, demonstrate financial need and have a minimum 3.0 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...
